tourName: 4 days in the Colombian Amazon holiday
generalInfo: Join us for an incredible 4-day journey into the heart of the Colombian Amazon! From the moment you board your flight from Bogotá to Leticia, you'll be captivated by the lush beauty and biodiversity of the region. Upon arrival, you'll be taken to your Amazon Jungle Ecolodge, where you'll spend the next 3 nights, and have the chance to embark on a thrilling night safari into the jungle on your first evening. The following days will be filled with cultural encounters, exploration of the rainforest, and unique experiences like canoeing down the Amazon River, trying your hand at Piranha fishing, and learning about the healing powers of plants from a Cocama medicine man. Your journey will also be enriched by the wisdom and traditions of the local indigenous communities, with a Shaman performing a traditional smoke bath blessing to connect you deeply with the jungle surroundings. On your last day, you'll have a quick tour of Leticia before heading back to Bogotá with unforgettable memories of your Amazon adventure.

dayInfo.description: You'll have a 2-hour flight from Bogotá over national parks into the heart of the Amazon; Leticia. You'll be collected from the airport and taken on a short drive through Leticia to the wharf, where you'll catch a boat up the Amazon River to your Amazon Jungle Ecolodge for the next 3 nights. You'll be arriving in the mid-afternoon after a boat ride of approximately 2 hours, and in time for a bit of relaxation before dinner. Following dinner when it is nice and dark you'll venture out on a night safari into the jungle, In search of tarantulas, giant insects, mammals, and different Amazonian fauna and flora. NB A Tourist Tax of $35.000 Colombian Pesos will need to be paid before leaving the airport

You'll start your day with a delicious breakfast at the eco-lodge before embarking on a short boat trip to the "Painted Village" of the Mocagua community. The vibrant murals, part of an art project by the Calanoa reserve, showcase the community's culture and contribute to environmental conservation. After lunch at the eco-lodge, you'll have the option to hike through the jungle to Matamata creek and canoe back down the Amazon River or visit Mocagua Island for a unique hike and the chance to spot the giant Lotus Victoria Amazonica. You can also try your hand at Piranha fishing from the eco-lodge dock. Your day will be filled with adventure, culture, and the beauty of the Amazon rainforest. Please note that the itinerary may be adjusted based on weather conditions and traveler preferences for a customized experience.

You'll explore the lush Milciades Gardens and learn about the healing powers of plants with a Cocama medicine man. After a delicious lunch, you'll spot camera-shy dolphins and witness a stunning sunset on the Amazon River. In the evening, a local Shaman will perform a traditional smoke bath blessing, connecting you deeply to the jungle surroundings. This unforgettable day will leave you with a newfound appreciation for the Amazon's natural beauty and the wisdom of its indigenous communities.

Following a relaxing breakfast, you'll be taken by boat back to Leticia and a quick tour of this small town on the border with Brazil and Peru before being transferred to Leticia airport and your flight back to Bogotá.

tourName: 4 days on the Pacific Coast, Colombia
generalInfo:
Indulge in a nature lover's dream as you embark on an unforgettable adventure package on the Pacific coast. Get up close and personal with magnificent humpback whales during thrilling whale-watching tours, where you can witness these majestic creatures in their natural habitat. Hike through lush jungles to mesmerizing waterfalls, where you can take a refreshing swim in the crystal-clear pools.

Your home for the duration of the trip is a serene eco-lodge, nestled in a picturesque location just a short stroll from the water's edge. Enjoy delicious meals made with fresh local ingredients, and learn about traditional processes such as panela making and Viche production, which are unique to the region. Take part in a fun cooking class and master the art of creating mouthwatering meals using the freshest ingredients.

For those seeking adventure, there are plenty of opportunities for snorkeling, diving, surfing, fishing, and paddleboarding. Rent equipment from nearby dive or surf centers and explore the stunning waters of the Pacific coast at your leisure.

dayInfo.description: Arriving at Nuquí, you'll be picked up from the airport and taken to the marina for a boat ride to your home for the next 3 nights. Located just a short stroll from the water's edge, this idyllic eco-lodge is a perfect escape from city life. you'll enjoy a delicious fresh lunch. Following that, you'll head out for a thrilling whale watching tour to catch a glimpse of the humpback whales that visit the area between May and November (best months are July to October). Upon returning to the eco-lodge, you can relax and soak in the beautiful surroundings. During your stay, you'll have the freedom to enjoy various activities such as a short hike to the Cascada del Amor (The waterfall of Love) for a refreshing swim, a visit to the Thermal Hot Springs (entrance fee not included), Ruta del Viche hike, Terco River hike, cooking class, and renting snorkeling, diving, surfing, fishing, or paddleboard equipment from a nearby center.

You'll wake to the wonderful relaxing sounds of the ocean and the native birds singing at the start of another beautiful Pacific Coast day! After breakfast, you'll be off in search of some of those amazingly wonderful humpback whales and their baby that will be swimming nearby. You'll be enjoying 2-3 hours out on the ocean before heading back to the eco-lodge for some me-time followed by another fresh lunch. Following lunch, you'll be walking along the beach for approximately an hour until you come to some wonderful thermal hot springs ($15,000 peso entrance fee not included). Once here you'll soak in the pools and relax in this amazing dream-like setting. You'll then venture back to the eco-lodge in time for a beautiful sunset and another wonderful dinner.

Wake up to the soothing sounds of waves and birdsong. After breakfast, hike to a beautiful waterfall along the Terco River, enjoying a refreshing swim. Return to the eco-lodge for lunch. In the afternoon, take a tour of a local trapiche (Panela factory) to learn about the process of making this traditional Colombian sweetener. Then, join a cooking class at the eco-lodge, using fresh ingredients to create delicious meals. End the day with a candlelit dinner by the ocean, savoring the gentle breeze and falling asleep to the sound of crashing waves.

You'll be waking once again to the soothing sounds of the waves and the singing birds searching for their morning meal. You'll have time for a quick swim or a short hike, and another wonderful breakfast before taking a boat back to Nuquí and on to the airport for your flight back to Medellín.

tourName: Barichara and the Caribbean tailor made holiday in Colombia
generalInfo:
Your 10-day adventure through Colombia will be an unforgettable experience, filled with stunning landscapes, rich history, and vibrant culture. The journey starts in Bucaramanga, a city known for its lush green hills and delicious local cuisine. From there, you'll be transferred to Barichara through the National Park Chicamocha, where you'll get to see the breathtaking views of the Andes mountains.

Once you arrive in Barichara, you'll be immersed in the town's authentic colonial architecture, picturesque streets, and vibrant local culture. The town is known for its handmade crafts, local gastronomy, and stunning views of the Suarez River Canyon. During your stay in Barichara, you'll get to experience the town's warm hospitality, relax in its peaceful ambiance, and indulge in its culinary delights.

Next, you'll head to Santa Marta, a charming town situated on the Caribbean coast. Here, you'll visit the nearby town of Minca, known for its rich biodiversity, stunning waterfalls, and coffee plantations. You'll also get to experience the natural beauty of Cabo San Juan a beautiful and secluded beach located in the heart of the Tayrona National Natural Park. The beach is known for its crystal-clear waters, pristine white sands, and stunning natural surroundings, and Taironaka where you'll have the opportunity to explore the ancient ruins of the Tairona civilization, which dates back to over 1,000 years. The site is located along the banks of the Don Diego River, and you can choose to go down the river by tubing, paddle, or taking a boat ride. As you make your way down the river, you'll pass through lush tropical forests and stunning landscapes, where you'll see a wide variety of wildlife and birds. It's a unique experience that allows you to appreciate the natural beauty of Colombia in a whole new way.

Then, you'll continue your journey to Cartagena, a vibrant city steeped in history, culture, and tradition. You'll walk through the colorful streets of the Old Town, a UNESCO World Heritage site, and visit the city's most iconic landmarks, such as the San Felipe Castle and the Cartagena Cathedral. You'll also get to enjoy the city's bustling nightlife and savor its exquisite cuisine.

You'll visit the Bazurto Market in Cartagena, where you'll discover a vibrant and colorful world of exotic fruits, vegetables, seafood, and meats. This bustling market is a true feast for the senses, and you'll have the chance to try some of the local specialties and interact with friendly vendors.

Finally, you'll head to the stunning Rosario Islands, a group of small coral islands located off the coast of Cartagena. Here, you'll have the chance to relax on the beautiful beaches, swim in crystal-clear waters, and explore the surrounding coral reefs.

dayInfo.description: Arrival Bucaramanga: Arrive at any time to be collected from the airport and taken directly on to your tour to Barichara. we offer a much better option to make this transfer a fantastic experience. You'll enjoy a 30-minute ride in the longest cable car in Colombia, with stunning panoramic views and a guided tour of the Chicamocha National Park. After disembarking, you'll enter Panachi and take a walking tour of the Guane Museum and other historical monuments. Then, your private transport will take you to Barichara. (Overnight in Barichara)

Hike through some of the most stunning landscapes in the region, with breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains and valleys. Once you arrive in Guane, you can explore the charming town and learn about its rich history and culture. But that's not all - the real highlight of this excursion is the gastronomical tour in Barichara that awaits you upon your return. For three hours, you'll get to indulge in some of the most delicious local cuisines, from traditional empanadas and arepas to artisanal chocolates. (Overnight in Barichara)

You’ll have a relaxing morning in Barichara before traveling back to Bucaramanga for an afternoon flight to Santa Marta. Once here you’ll be collected and taken directly to your hotel in Santa Marta. (Overnight in Santa Marta)

Explore the charming town of Minca and its cozy cafes and artisan shops. Take a coffee tour to discover the secrets behind Colombia's liquid gold. Learn about the process of making delicious chocolate, and even indulge in a chocolate facemask. Discover hidden waterfalls and take a refreshing swim in the cool waters (remember to bring your swimming trunks). Keep an eye out for exotic birds throughout your mountain adventure in Minca.

You’ll be taken to Tayrona Park and enjoy a 2-hour ecological walk through the jungle and visit 4 beaches along the way including Arenillas, La Piscina, Cabo San Juan, and Los Arrecifes. You'll also enjoy some fantastic beach time (approx. 3 hours), along with time to explore the area or partake in some watersports, such as snorkeling. After your beach time has passed you'll enjoy a 1.3-hour walk through the jungle and your waiting transportation. During your ecological walks, you will learn about the local environment and the local indigenous. You'll learn about what native animals can be seen and or hear. Your guide will also be safeguarding your possessions while you're relaxing in the temperate waters and taking as many photos as you may need. (Overnight Santa Marta)

Collected from your Santa Marta hotel at 8 am, you’ll venture into the Sierra Nevada jungle, driving for approximately 1.5 hours to the entrance of Rio Don Diego. From there, you’ll take a 15-minute boat ride up the river to Tayronaka, an ancient archaeological site surrounded by stunning natural beauty. You’ll explore the ruins and artifacts with your guide, who will answer any questions you have about the history of the location. Then, you'll visit the nearby Kogui community, where you'll meet some of the direct descendants of the Tayrona people. After enjoying a typical lunch, you'll have the option to kayak, paddleboard, or float back down the river to the Caribbean Sea. Here, you can relax on the beach and witness a beautiful sunset before returning to your hotel. It's another day in paradise in Colombia. (Overnight Santa Marta)

Relax in a morning drive along the coast to your waiting hotel in Cartagena. Once here you’ll check into your hotel and enjoy some Free Time before your 4pm city tour. You'll explore the charming colonial streets, plazas, restaurants, cafes, and bars within the walled city, along with one of the oldest and most bohemian neighborhoods in Cartagena. Visit the iconic landmarks such as the Clock Tower monument, Bolivar Park, Plaza Saint Pedro Claver, Plaza de Los Jagüeyes, San Diego, and the colorful streets of Gertsemani while learning about the city's historic struggle between the Spanish colonialists and pirates from different nations. (Overnight Cartagena)

Enjoy a wonderful ocean cruise on a speedboat to the Rosario Islands; arriving at a beautiful picturesque beach for a typical Caribbean lunch, crystal clear waters, water-sports, white sands, and palm trees. You'll be assigned your personal beach space which will be exclusive for yourself and members of your group.

Explore the colorful neighborhood of Getsemani and its hip cafes, bars, and restaurants with a bilingual guide. Visit Centenario Park and Holy Trinity Square, and discover the hidden gems of this vibrant area. Then, head to the Bazurto markets to learn about daily life and sample exotic fruits and meats, followed by an authentic lunch at Celia's restaurant. Finish off with a stroll through the artisan and community area and a refreshing freshly made juice of your choice. At 4:30 you'll have the best closure for your trip; a sunset Catamaran Cruise(Overnight Cartagena)
Hablamos pronto, safe travels home, and visit again soon! We’ll have transport waiting to take you to the airport at your desired time.

tourName: Bogota, Amazon, and Medellin tailor made tour
generalInfo:
Welcome to an 11-day adventure that will take you through some of the most spectacular and diverse regions of Colombia. Your journey begins in the heart of the country, in the vibrant and bustling capital city of Bogotá. Here, you'll explore the charming and historic neighborhood of La Candelaria, home to colonial-era architecture and the famous Gold Museum, which houses an impressive collection of pre-Hispanic artifacts. And no visit to Bogotá would be complete without a trip to the top of Monserrate Mountain, where you'll take in breathtaking views of the city from above.

From Bogotá, you'll travel deep into the Amazon rainforest, one of the most biodiverse regions on the planet. You'll hike through the jungle, exploring its hidden corners and learning about the plants and animals that call this incredible place home. You'll visit Mocagua Island, and learn about the traditional Cocama way of life and their ancient knowledge of medicinal plants. You'll have the opportunity to see pink river dolphins up close, one of the most unique and enchanting experiences you'll ever have.

Next, it's off to the Eternal Spring City of Medellín, where you'll discover the vibrant culture and fascinating history of this once-notorious city. You'll take a city tour that includes the highlights of Medellín. You'll also visit the colorful Comuna 13 neighborhood, which has transformed from a dangerous and impoverished area to a vibrant and diverse community. You'll sample some of the delicious local fruits, which are known for their exotic flavors and health benefits.

Finally, you'll head to the Pacific coast, where you'll stay at the beautiful eco-lodge. Here, you'll have the opportunity to explore the rugged coastline, with its pristine beaches and dense jungle. You can go hiking, kayaking, or simply relax and soak in the natural beauty of this incredible place. And you'll also have the chance to sample some of the delicious local cuisine, which is known for its fresh seafood and bold flavors.

Overall, this 11-day adventure is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to explore some of the most incredible regions of Colombia, from the high Andes to the steamy Amazon jungle and the wild Pacific coast. With a mix of adventure, culture, and relaxation, this trip is sure to be an unforgettable experience.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Bogotá, arrive at any time to be collected from the airport and taken to your accommodation. Depending on your arrival time we can provide you with another tour or with suggestions of places to see and where to go. Be sure to drink plenty of water to help you adapt to the altitude. (Overnight Bogotá)

Explore the historic heart of Bogotá on a guided tour through La Candelaria, taking in important landmarks such as Bolivar Plaza, the Palace of Justice and the Catedral Primada de Colombia. After strolling through the incredible El Museo del Oro, you'll ascend to the summit of Monserrate, learning about the mountain's significance to the indigenous Musica people and enjoying stunning views of Bogotá from 10,341 ft (3152m) above sea level. (Overnight Bogotá)

Relax on a 2-hour flight over national parks into the heart of the Amazon; Leticia. You'll be collected from the airport and be taken on a short drive through Leticia to the wharf, where you'll catch a boat up the Amazon River to your Amazon Jungle Ecolodge for the next 3 nights. You'll be arriving in the mid-afternoon after a boat ride of approximately 2 hours, and in time for a bit of relaxation before dinner. Following dinner when it is nice and dark you'll venture out on a night safari into the jungle, In search of tarantulas, giant insects, mammals, and different Amazonian fauna and flora. (Overnight in Eco-lodge)

Enjoy a delicious breakfast before embarking on a short trip up the Amazon River to explore the "Painted Village" of a Mocagua community, featuring stunning murals that promote traditional culture and sustainable management of forest and river resources. After lunch, take a hike through the Calanoa Reserve to the Matamata creek, surrounded by thick jungle, and paddle back down the Amazon River in a canoe for an unforgettable experience of navigating the jungle canopy. In the afternoon, head to Mocagua Island to discover unique flora and fauna, including the giant Victoria Amazonica lily, before finishing the day trying your hand at fishing for the mighty Piranhas back at the Eco-lodge.

Embark on a boat to visit the Milciades Gardens and meet a Cocama medicine man with vast knowledge of traditional forest cultivation and the healing powers of plants. Enjoy spotting pink and grey dolphins unique to the Amazon region and a home visit from a local Shaman for a smoke bath blessing in the evening.

Start your day bright and early with a bird watching adventure at 6 am, where you'll witness the morning rituals of various species in their natural habitat. After a fresh breakfast, take a short tour of Leticia before catching your flight to Medellin. (Overnight Medellin)

Start your day at 8 am with a cable car ride over Comuna 13, a street art district and home to displaced people. Ride the world's first outdoor escalators and learn about the graffiti's meanings. Afterward, enjoy a fruit tasting at Plaza la America and visit Parques del Río, featuring a unique sculpture by Swiss artist Ugo Rondinone. Experience the Barefoot Park's sensory pathways, visit important heritage buildings, and see Fernando Botero's sculptures at Botero Plaza. The tour ends at Parque Memorial Inflexion, a memorial park honoring victims of narcoterrorism. The tour finishes at 3:30 pm, giving you the rest of the day to explore Medellin. (Overnight Medellin)

Embark on an adventure starting at 8 am with a picturesque drive to a breathtaking coffee farm in Antioquia. There, you'll experience a comprehensive tour and learn all about the intricate process of growing the perfect coffee bean. Next, you'll visit Old Peñol Replica Town in Guatape, followed by a trip to Guatape Rock, also known as Piedra del Peñol. Climb the 740 steps to the top for stunning views and a memorable experience. Lastly, you'll explore the charming town of Guatape, making for a perfect end to your day. (Overnight Medellin)

Enjoy a short flight to Nuquí arriving around mid-morning. Upon arrival at Nuquí, you'll be greeted at the airport and whisked away to the marina for a scenic boat ride to your home for the next three nights - La Bayka eco-lodge. Nestled in a stunning location, just a short walk from the water's edge, La Bayka is the perfect place to unwind and escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life. After settling in, you'll be treated to a delicious fresh lunch. In addition to enjoying the natural beauty of the surrounding area, your stay also includes a guided 30-minute walk to Cascada del Amor, where you can take a refreshing swim, a one-hour guided walk to the Thermal Hot Springs (entrance fee not included), and a 2-3 hour whale watching tour (available from July to mid-October). Please note, there is a tourist tax of $30,000 Colombian Pesos per person that needs to be paid before leaving the airport.
You'll wake to the wonderful relaxing sounds of the ocean and the native birds singing at the start of another beautiful Pacific Coast day!

You'll be waking once again to the soothing sounds of the waves and the singing birds searching for their morning meal. You'll have time for a quick swim or a short hike, and another wonderful breakfast before taking a boat back to Nuquí and on to the airport for your flight back to Medellín. On arrival, you'll be collected and taken directly to your hotel to check-in and relax in the city of the eternal spring.

generalInfo:
19-day adventure through Colombia's most captivating destinations! Your journey begins in Bogotá, where you'll delve into the city's fascinating history and culture. Marvel at the stunning colonial architecture of the Candelaria district and explore the renowned Gold Museum. Take in panoramic views of the city from atop Monserrate, and venture outside of the city to visit the breathtaking Salt Cathedral of Zipaquirá and the charming town of Raquir to go to Villa de Leyva.

After an overnight stay in the picturesque colonial town of Villa de Leyva, we'll return to Bogotá to catch a flight to the Coffee Zone. You'll be taken to breathtaking Cocora Valley, where you'll marvel at the towering wax palms and soak in the stunning scenery. Then, we'll visit the charming town of Filandia, known for its vibrant colors and quaint cafes. Next, indulge in a coffee tour in Salento, where you'll learn about Colombia's renowned coffee culture and savor some of the world's finest coffee. From there, we'll continue our journey to Santa Marta.

From there, we'll journey to the lush mountain town of Minca, nestled in the Sierra Nevada mountain range. Take in the stunning scenery and explore the waterfalls.

Next, we'll head to the stunning Cabo San Juan beach in Tayrona National Park. Bask in the sun on pristine white sands, swim in crystal-clear waters, and explore the park's lush jungle trails. Then, we'll visit Taironaka, a fascinating archaeological site that tells the story of the Tayrona people who once lived here.

Your journey ends in Cartagena, where you'll explore the colonial charm of Cartagena with a city tour and visit the historic Getsemani neighborhood. Discover the vibrant Bazurto Market and take a sunset cruise along the coast. Finally, relax on the beautiful Rosario Islands before concluding your journey with memories to last a lifetime..

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Bogotá - Arrive at any time to be collected from the airport and taken to your accommodation. Depending on your arrival time we can provide you with another tour or with suggestions of places to see and where to go. Be sure to drink plenty of water to help you adapt to the altitude. (Overnight Bogotá)

Explore the historic heart of Bogotá on a guided excursion through La Candelaria, taking in important landmarks such as Bolivar Plaza, the Palace of Justice and the Catedral Primada de Colombia. After strolling through the incredible El Museo del Oro, you'll ascend to the summit of Monserrate, learning about the mountain's significance to the indigenous Musica people and enjoying stunning views of Bogotá from 10,341 ft (3152m) above sea level. (Overnight Bogotá)

Explore the Salt Cathedral of Zipaquira, the artisan town of Raquira, and the colonial town of Villa de Leyva on a 9-hour tour. See the incredible church made from an ancient salt mine, shop for Colombian-made artisanal goods, and experience the charm of a historic town. (Overnight Villa de Leyva)

Stroll through the beautiful cobblestone streets, visit the Monasterio Del Santo Eccehomo built in 1620, see the Terracotta House (the largest piece of pottery in the world), and visit the Fossil Museum where you can meet and touch the dinosaurs that roamed the area millions of years ago. After your tour of Villa de Leyva, you will start your journey back to Bogotá with a stop at El Puente de Boyacá, the site of the final battle for independence from Spain. (Overnight in Bogotá)
Enjoy a short flight to Pereira where your transport will be waiting to take you directly to your hotel in Salento. (Overnight Salento) Optional tour: Thermal pools of Santa Rosa

After breakfast, embark on a trip to the lush Cocora Valley for a guided tour of the Wax Palm Forest. Marvel at the tallest wax palms in the world and take in the breathtaking views of the valley. Spend a few hours walking through this peaceful zone and immerse yourself in the natural beauty of the area. Next, travel to the colorful town of Filandia, known for its delicious gastronomy, wonderful Colombian culture, and fabulous views. Stop for lunch at one of the many fantastic restaurants and take a walking tour to capture photos of the beautiful buildings. Visit the mirador (lookout) for spectacular 360-degree views of the town and its surroundings. (Overnight in Salento)

Start your day with an unforgettable coffee tour that is considered one of the best in Colombia. This tour is unique because the single lady owner has created a Finca that is completely pesticide and machinery-free, with every part of the process done by hand. Discover the traditional methods of growing the perfect coffee bean and explore the wonderful Finca where you'll find a large variety of fruits growing alongside the coffee plants. Learn the complete process from the seed to the cup, including handpicking a few beans yourself. Take an afternoon flight to Medellin (Overnight Medellin)

Start your day at 8 am with a cable car ride over Comuna 13, a street art district and home to displaced people. Ride the world's first outdoor escalators and learn about graffiti's meanings. Afterward, enjoy a fruit tasting at Plaza la America and visit Parques del Río, featuring a unique sculpture by Swiss artist Ugo Rondinone. Experience the Barefoot Park's sensory pathways, visit important heritage buildings, and see Fernando Botero's sculptures at Botero Plaza. The tour ends at Parque Memorial Inflexion, a memorial park honoring victims of narcoterrorism. The tour finishes at 3:30 pm, giving you the rest of the day to explore Medellin. (Overnight Medellin)

You'll be taken on a scenic drive through Antioquia to Guatape Rock. You'll have the opportunity to climb the 740 steps to the top for breathtaking views. You'll also visit Guatape town, known as the City of Zocalos, where you'll walk the streets, visit the main square, and maybe even take a tuk-tuk ride. Finally, you'll check in to the Guatape Hotel for some well-deserved rest. (Overnight Guatape)

Your day will start at 7 am and you'll be taken to a Cocoa Finca near San Rafael, where you'll have a delicious breakfast and explore the cocoa plantation on an easy hike. Along the way, you'll encounter tropical birds and Marmoset monkeys. After the hike, you'll enjoy a traditional lunch called a Fiambre and learn how to make chocolate using a traditional artisan method. You'll then get to create your very own chocolate bar with your choice of mixes and nuts. The tour continues with a swim in the Arenales River and an exfoliation using a mixture of fresh chocolate and the husk of the cocoa bean. Finally, you'll be transported back to your hotel with unforgettable memories of this Colombian adventure. (Overnight Medellin)
Free Day or an Optional tour of Jerico. (Overnight Medellin)

Enjoy a short flight to Santa Marta arriving around mid-afternoon. Your transport will be waiting to collect you and take you directly to your hotel. There are no activities planned for this day, so just relax, drink plenty of bottled water (it's hot here), and maybe check out a beach nearby. (Overnight Santa Marta)

Minca, is a charming town nestled in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, is just a short distance away from Santa Marta. The town boasts a cooler climate than the coast, so don't forget to pack a jumper for the fresh mountain nights. During your visit, you'll be surrounded by lush mountains, tropical forests, walking tracks, hidden waterfalls, beautiful views, and the simple living of the mountain life. There are many exciting things to do in Minca. You can go trekking on the many walking tracks that range from a couple of hours to a full day, where you'll discover some beautiful locations that will take your breath away. Take a dip in one of the many hidden waterfalls, such as Marinka Falls, and enjoy the cool, refreshing water. (Overnight Santa Marta)

Explore the stunning mix of tropical jungle, white sands, and Caribbean blue ocean at Cabo San Juan in Tayrona Park. Enjoy a 2-hour ecological walk through the jungle, visit 4 beaches, and indulge in 3 hours of beach time with optional watersports like snorkeling. Learn about the local environment, animals, and indigenous people on your walk with a knowledgeable guide (Overnight Santa Marta)

You'll start your adventure at 8 am from your Santa Marta hotel and drive for 1.5 hours to Rio Don Diego. After a 15-minute boat ride, you'll reach Tayronaka where you'll explore ancient ruins and a museum for about an hour with a guide. You'll also meet the Kogui community and receive an "aseguranza" to safeguard your future travels. After lunch, you'll kayak, paddleboard, or float down the river before relaxing on the beach and watching the sunset. You'll return to your hotel in the evening. (Overnight Santa Marta)

Relax in a morning drive along the coast to your waiting hotel in Cartagena. Once here you’ll check into your hotel and enjoy some Free Time before your 4pm city tour. You'll explore the charming colonial streets, plazas, restaurants, cafes, and bars within the walled city, along with one of the oldest and most bohemian neighborhoods in Cartagena. Visit the iconic landmarks such as the Clock Tower monument, Bolivar Park, Plaza Saint Pedro Claver, Plaza de Los Jagüeyes, San Diego, and the colorful streets of Gertsemani while learning about the city's historic struggle between the Spanish colonialists and pirates from different nations. (Overnight Cartagena)

Enjoy a wonderful ocean cruise on a speedboat to the Rosario Islands; arriving at a beautiful picturesque beach for a typical Caribbean lunch, crystal clear waters, water-sports, white sands, and palm trees. You'll be assigned your personal beach space which will be exclusive for yourself and members of your group. (Overnight Cartagena)

Explore the vibrant streets and graffiti-filled neighborhoods of Cartagena with a bilingual guide, discovering hidden cafes, bars, and restaurants. Then, venture into the bustling Colombian markets of Bazurto, where you'll learn about the daily lives of hard-working Colombians and sample exotic tropical fruits and freshly cut meats. Enjoy an authentic lunch at a local restaurant and browse the artisan and community area, complete with games and hand-painted posters. End your day by watching one of the world's most beautiful sunsets aboard a catamaran on Cartagena's bay. A truly romantic and unforgettable experience. (Overnight Cartagena)
Hablamos pronto, safe travels home, and visit again soon! We’ll have transport waiting to take you to the airport at your desired time.

generalInfo:
Welcome to your 4-day adventure package in the beautiful region of Casanare, Colombia! You will be picked up from Yopal airport and taken on a scenic 2.5-hour drive through stunning Orinoquia landscapes to the Natural Reserve of Guanapalo, where you will spend all three nights.

Guanapalo Natural Reserve is a true paradise for nature lovers and is located on the banks of the beautiful Pauto River. The reserve is known for its outstanding biodiversity, where you will find a variety of birds, reptiles, amphibians, and mammals, including capybaras, ballas (small alligators), palm and honey bears, wild horses, howler monkeys, armadillos, foxes, turtles, wild pigs, and pumas. In addition to its rich wildlife, the reserve is home to the Llanera culture, where you can learn about the local customs and traditions.

On the first day of your adventure, after settling into your accommodations, you will embark on a 4-hour safari tour on an open-top 4x4 vehicle. You will explore the vast nature reserve and get up close to some of the amazing wildlife that thrives in this region. Keep your eyes peeled for colorful birds and elusive animals.

On the second day, you will start your morning with an exhilarating birdwatching tour during sunrise. Afterward, you will take a walking safari tour to explore more of the reserve's stunning landscape. In the afternoon, you will ride on horseback for a unique safari experience.

On the third day, you will explore the Pauto River and its surroundings with a canoe safari tour and attend a workshop on the traditional Colombian cowboy lifestyle, which is deeply ingrained in the Llanera culture.

Finally, on the fourth day, you will have a leisurely morning before being driven back to Yopal airport. This incredible 4-day package will provide you with a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to experience the beauty and diversity of Colombia.

dayInfo.description: You’ll be collected from the airport in Yopal and take a relaxing journey of around 2-2.5 hours through some beautiful Orinoquia landscapes to your Hato (Typical farmhouse of the region). On arrival at your Hato, you’ll be greeted with warm smiles and be shown to your room for the next 2 nights in the Casanare. Once you’ve freshened up it’ll be time for a wonderful typical lunch of the region. After lunch, it’s climbing into an open-top 4x4 and off on your first 3-4 hour safari of this magnificent area in search of some of the many wild animals that thrive in this region. (Overnight in traditional hato)

Rising with the sun you'll take a quick coffee or juice before heading out on foot for a couple of hours to check out the amazing abundance of birdlife in this region. Next, it's back to the lodge for some breakfast and maybe a quick nap before you're off again around 10:30am for a guided walking safari to build up your appetite before lunch. Following lunch, you'll have a bit of me time to just enjoy your surroundings before venturing out on another 3-4 hour safari. But this time on horseback for a new experience in this beautiful location. (Overnight in Traditional Hato)

Waking with the sounds of the wildlife and the light peaking into your room you'll rise and enjoy this beautiful sunrise on your last day in this paradise. With time to head down to the lake and enjoy the golden hours of light for some wonderful photography before breakfast, you'll quickly down coffee and be on your way. Returning for breakfast and time for another safari on your choice of a canoe (if in the wet season), or on foot. You'll venture out for a couple more hours in search of some more magical moments to share between yourself and these wild animals. Enjoy one more lunch in this wonderful location of the Colombian Casanare, followed by an experience learning about the life of the Llanos cowboys. Discover their tools of the trade, their artisan-crafted utensils, and about the indigenous who inhabit these lands.
Enjoy a relaxing morning in your Hato before being transferred to Yopal for your flight back to Bogotá

generalInfo:
Discover this land of contrasts on this fascinating tour of Colombia's highlights. Begin by soaking up the history of the diverse and busy capital, Bogotá. Marvel at the architectural feat of the Salt Cathedral and learn the secrets of growing arguably the best coffee in the world, in the verdant Coffee Triangle. Travel to the rejuvenated city of Medellin, home to Botero's famous sculptures and artwork. Finally, lose yourself in the historic and picturesque city of Cartagena, taking time to admire the magnificent architecture that gives the city its UNESCO World Heritage status.

TOUR HIGHLIGHTS
Wander cosmopolitan Bogotá
The internationally acclaimed Museo Botero
The colossal Salt Cathedral of Zipaquirá
The colonial gem of Villa de Leyva
Traditional villages in the Coffee Triangle
Learn about the coffee-making process in the heart of Colombia's coffee region
Medellín, Colombia's 'City of Eternal Spring'
Marvel at Cartagena’s beautiful architecture
PLACES VISITED
Bogotá - Salt Cathedral of Zipaquirá - Villa de Leyva - Pereira - Valle de Cocora - Filandia & Salento - Medellín - Cartagena

WHAT'S INCLUDED
Arrival & departure transfers
Ground transport with driver
Domestic flights
Accommodation
Meals (refer to itinerary for meal plan)
English-speaking guides
Entrance fees to sites & parks

dayInfo.description: Arrive at the airport in Bogotá where you will be met by a travel representative. Transfer to the hotel. The rest of the day is free for you to explore Bogotá at your own pace.

AAfter breakfast, embark on a half-day visit to the historic centre of Bogotá known as La Candelaria. Visit the Plaza de Bolívar, where a statue of the great liberator Simón Bolívar is located. The visit continues with the renowned Museo Botero and Museo del Oro. The afternoon is free for your to explore Bogotá at your leisure. Meal plan: breakfast.

Depart Bogotá and head north towards Zipaquirá, travelling through the Bogotá savannah. After a journey of 1-1.5 hours, reach the impressive Salt Cathedral, a true feat of engineering. The excursion will begin by visiting the cathedral in a tunnel that passes the fourteen Stations of the Cross and continues to the dome. Next, reach the enormous cross carved into the saline rock and finally the three naves of the Cathedral that represent the birth, life and death of Christ. Later, we visit the mine where there is an excellent auditorium that can seat up to two hundred people, host film screenings and events such as fashion shows. The trip ends at a mirror of water where it is possible to experience the amazing visual effects of water on carved saline rock. Continue on a 2-hour trip to Villa de Leyva in the afternoon. Upon arrival to Villa de Leyva, check in at the hotel. Meal plan: breakfast.

Enjoy this colonial jewel, discovering its cultural and ecological attractions. Visit the Fossil Museum, founded in 1977 and located 5.5 km away from Villa de Leyva. The museum was built exactly at the place where a kronosaurus was discovered. On the outskirts of the town, visit El Infiernito, a pre-Hispanic Muisca site, where around 30 stone columns known as megaliths are located. It is believed that these columns are about 2,200 years old, and that this space was reserved for the cult of fertility by the phallic shape of the stones. Others, on the other hand, believe that it was used as an astronomical observatory. Return to the hotel. Meal plan: breakfast.

After breakfast, return to Bogotá. On the way, stop at the Convento del Santo Ecce Homo. Founded by the Dominicans in 1620, this was an important point of evangelisation in a region populated by indigenous communities. The tour ends at Bogotá Airport for your departure flight to Pereira in the evening. On your arrival in Pereira, you will be met by a Travel The Unknown representative and transferred to your hotel in the coffee region. Meal plan: breakfast.

After breakfast, leave for the Valle de Cocora in the central mountains of the department of Quindío. Upon arrival in the valley, either hiking or on horseback (not included), head into the cloud forest to enjoy the biodiversity of flora and fauna. On the return journey, cross the River Quindío while walking along an ecological pathway that takes you past the tallest wax palms in the world. Learn why the indigenous people here worshipped this tree. Then enjoy a typical lunch and enjoy some free time here. In the afternoon, continue 10 km towards the traditional town of Salento to enjoy a tour that visits the Plaza de Bolívar with its colourful balconies, the Calle Real, the handicrafts shops and the Cocora viewpoint. Then, transfer to the village of Filandia to enjoy a tour that includes a viewpoint, colonial homes, the Plaza de Bolívar and the coffee shops. Here, enjoy some time soaking up the regional atmosphere and perhaps some local spirits before returning to the hotel. Meal plan: breakfast & lunch.

Today, enjoy a half-day visit to the coffee plantations along the steep hills typical of this area. Visit Hacienda San Alberto, one of the traditional coffee estates located near the town of Buenavista Quindío. The tour begins with an introductory talk about coffee, its preparation, toasting, the characteristics of quality and the properties that allow for such a variety of coffees in the world. The route continues through the plantations, allowing you to appreciate the work of the coffee pickers. Walk through the coffee plantations and learn about the production system in detail, including the harvest, the drying in the sun and treatment in this land of volcanic terrain along the Central Andes Mountain Range which has been declared a world Heritage site by UNESCO and that offers the perfect climatic conditions for coffee growing. Free remainder of the afternoon for individual activities. Meal plan: breakfast.

After breakfast, transfer to the city of Medellín (a 6-8 hour drive). During the journey, stop at the Mirador del Pipinta for views over the Cauca River. Upon arrival in Medellín, check in to your hotel. The rest of the day is free for you to explore Medellín at leisure. Meal plan: breakfast.

Today, you head to the town of Guatapé to visit the enormous El Peñol rock. The journey to El Peñol takes around two hours, during which you will have time to appreciate the outstanding landscape of Antioquia. Visit the picturesque village of Guatapé where all of the houses are painted in quaint pastel colours and after lunch, visit the Guatapé reservoir, with a 30-minute boat tour. For those who wish to climb El Peñol for outstanding views, there will be time for this before your return to Medellín. Meal plan: breakfast & lunch.

After breakfast, begin a half-day tour to visit the areas of Medellín that best represent the social transformation that has taken place in the city over the last 20 years. In the 1980s and '90s, Medellín was one of the most dangerous cities in the world, with the notorious drug lord, Pablo Escobar, and his Medellín Cartel operating at their peak. With his death in 1993, the reign of 'El Patrón' came to an end, but it took until 2002 for the city to start seeing real changes, when the government began to invest heavily in infrastructure and public education. Nowadays, the 'City of Eternal Spring' is one of the most innovative metropolises in the world. Visit the barrio San Javier, which used to be one of the most unsafe suburbs of Medellín. Located 7 km from the city centre, it is an excellent example of the social transformation that has taken place over the last few years. Arrive here by the Metrocable that joins the north-east area with the city centre, the installation of which has been life-changing for many of the inhabitants of Medellín. Learn more about the city’s transformation after the death of Pablo Escobar and explore Medellin’s newest invention: the outdoor escalators in the Comuna 13 district. Discover stories about the district's past by visiting the most important places marked by historical events and see graffiti that acts as a form of artistic expression for the community. Enjoy beautiful views over the city from San Javier. Then, continue to La Plazoleta (renamed Plaza Botero) located in the city centre. This area fell into decline in the 1980s but today houses 23 sculptures by Fernando Botero. The artist donated the sculptures to the city in 2000 and thus contributed to the cultural transformation of the city. After the tour, the rest of the day is at leisure for you to explore Medellín at your own pace. Meal plan: breakfast.

After breakfast, transfer to the airport for your direct flight to Cartagena. Upon arrival, transfer to the hotel. The evening is free for you to explore Cartagena independently. Meal plan: breakfast.

Begin your half-day city tour with panoramic views of the city from the Convento de La Popa. Continue to the Castillo San Felipe and walk around the fortress, learning about the castle's construction, the feats of engineering to build it, the tunnels, underground galleries and passageways. Then, continue to the Ciudad Vieja (old city) to visit the Convent and Church of the San Pedro Claver compound, built in the 17th century. Lastly, head to Bovedas, a collection of archways built into Cartagena's city walls and used until the end of the 18th century to house armaments, then later as a prison. Nowadays, it’s an artisan centre where handicrafts can be browsed and purchased. The afternoon is free for you to explore Cartagena at your own pace. Meal plan: breakfast.
Enjoy a full day at leisure to explore Cartagena independently. Meal plan: breakfast.
At a suitable time, you will be collected and transferred to the airport for your flight to Bogotá for onward travel or your flight home. Meal plan: breakfast.

generalInfo:
Bogota-Popayan-Cali-Salento-Medellin-Rio Claro-Medellin-Bahia Solano-Medellin

The capital of Colombia is a colourful city like no other. Tour the cobbled cultural centre, sample coffee and be awed by graffiti. Take a trip to Monserrate mountain and see the panorama from above.

The second city on your itinerary is Popayan: home to magnificently traditional Colombian markets. Gain a greater understanding of Colombian culture at a home cooked lunch with a local family.

Next stop: immerse in the buzzing Salsa dancing spirit of Santiago de Cali.

On to Salento where you will be staying a stones throw from the central square. Sample coffee and feel small under the sky- high wax palms.

Head back to the city and immerse in the characterful, fast paced style of life in Medellin. Enjoy the company of an expert local guide for the day, who will take you off the beaten path and over it too, by cable car. Later, if you fancy, head out to experience the party scene.

Journey to the heart of Colombian adventure in Rio Claro, an outdoors haven within a stunning canyon. Your accommodation is open to nature and an experience like no other in and of itself. You can do as little or as much as you please here- from white water rafting, to ziplining, and a plethora of scenic hikes.

Continue your nature adventure towards the pacific coastline and spot humpback whales. Over the next few days, stay in a Colombian eco lodge with the magnificent jungle as a backdrop and hike through the rainforests with another expert guide..

This trip is all about visiting the pockets of peace in the metropolis and adventure in the wilderness. It is surely unrivalled in the unique breadth of excursions on offer. An absolute must do for anyone planning on visiting South America!

dayInfo.description: BIENVENIDOS A BOGOTA: Colombia’s vibrant, mountain-flanked capital has come to symbolise the country’s resurgence as a whole. Once considered one of the world’s most dangerous cities, it now welcomes visitors with open arms, and has the history, architecture and charm to be much more than just a starting point for your Colombian adventure. You’ll stay 2 nights in the colourful cobbled cultural centre – La Candelaria – filled with art, food and beautiful colonial buildings and plazas. We’ll also arrange a trip to the mountain of Monserrate with a local guide, so you can admire this great South American city from above.

COLOURFUL MARKETS OF THE WHITE CITY- POPAYAN: Today you’ll take a short flight to the whitewashed colonial town of Popayan. Your hotel is right in the heart of the atmospheric old town, with cosy plazas and intricate cathedrals. The next day you will explore the heart of Popayan with your guide – its famous markets. From locally grown produce to traditional medicine, there’s plenty to see. Add colours, traditional clothing and tasty snacks that you’ll try along the way, and you’ll be fully immersed into the local way of life. To make your experience even more special, you’ll then have your lunch with a local family. Hearty home-made traditional meal and a warm welcome from the locals is exactly what you’ll need after a few hours of chaos and excitement. The rest of the day is free for you to do as you please.

SALSA DOWN THE STREETS OF CALI: Next stop is Cali, officially Santiago de Cali, the city best known for its free spirit and seductive salsa. Without the obligatory must-sees there’s plenty to keep you entertained: from bars to local eateries and of course salsa skilfully performed by the calenos right on the streets. Feel free to join! Your charming traditional posada is perfectly located not far from all the buzz of the centre. While in Cali, you’ll get to explore the region’s culinary scene on a street-food tour. From chontaduro to lulada, to ceviche colombiano – all these words will make sense to you afterwards!

SKY-HIGH TREES AND STEAMING COFFEES SALENTO: Next you’ll travel to Armenia by bus, and onto Salento by private transfer. You’ll spend three nights in a colourful accommodation with Colombian flair that’s conveniently situated for you to be able to walk to the main square with many bars and restaurants.? During your stay, you’ll head out on three-hour coffee tour, where you’ll learn all there is to know about growing and selling the best coffee in the world. Colombia exports the majority of its best beans, so the plantation that you’ll visit is a great place to taste the best this region has to offer. No trip to this region is complete without a to visit the famous Cocora valley, so we’ll also organise you a ticket for a return trip in a classic “Willys” jeep.?Once in the valley, you can walk directly to the sky-high wax palms, or you go through a gate to the right and take a beautiful four to five hour hike over hills with stunning views of the valley.?

ETERNAL SPRING IN MEDELLIN: With a seemingly ever-pleasant climate and a stunning location surrounded by steep hills and jagged peaks, Medellín is quickly shaking off its infamous past to become one of Colombia’s must-visit cities. You’ll find a character and fast-paced attitude which sets the city apart from the rest of the nation, and it can be a lot of fun to be a part of for a few days! You’ll spend 2 nights in a comfortable hotel in the trendy El Poblado district, with a host of restaurants and bars nearby. On your second day you’ll take a tour with a local paisa (Medellín resident) guide who’ll show you the ins and outs (and highs and lows) of their city, including the cable cars which connect downtown with the neighbourhoods high up in the hills, and give a spectacular view of the city. You’ll also see the Botero statues, and some lesser-know highlights, before you’re left to explore, relax, or maybe experience a little of the city’s famous party scene!

ADVENTURES IN RIO CLARO: Heaven for nature lovers and a complete change of scenery after meddling Medellin, Rio Claro is well known to the locals who flock here for the weekend of fun and outdoorsy activities. Not so much on the international tourists radar yet, it’s a peaceful spot with the stunning canyon, clear blue river and the jungle as a backdrop. You’ll stay in a unique lodge built right into the canyon walls with the front open out into nature leaving no boundaries between you and the wilderness. This place is all about the activities and the great outdoors. Choose as many as you can pack in a day, from white-water rafting to ziplining and as many scenic hikes as you can handle. After a day full of adventures, fall asleep to the sounds of the jungle before heading back to Medellin for another night there.

THE WHALES AND THE RAINFOREST BAHIA SOLANO: Today you’ll swap the buzz of the big city for the sound of the ocean waves. Only a 1-hour flight separates you from the serene coastline of the Pacific, where the humpbacks come to play, making it one of the best places in Colombia to spot them. With the jungle as a backdrop, this remote and unexplored paradise is just the place for a bit of adventures. For the next few days, you’ll stay in a charming local eco-lodge, spot the gentle giants of the sea and explore the rainforest on a guided hike.

FINAL NIGHT IN MEDELLIN AND DEPARTURE: For your final night, you will head back to Medellin and return to the same charming boutique hotel. Surrounded by the lush tropical gardens and decorated with the original Colombian artwork, it’s a peaceful haven amidst the buzzing metropolis. You’ll find an array of restaurants, art galleries and all the big city’s amenities within walking distance. The following day your transfer will be waiting at the hotel for your journey to the airport to catch your flight home.

generalInfo: In a country such as Colombia, planning a two week  holiday comes with a question. Do you see more of less or less of more? This trip is all about giving you the time to really get to know the destinations you are visiting, learning from the people about the places they call home. You will explore the stunning mountains of the coffee region, experiencing working haciendas, ancient coffee farms and the stunning nature that surrounds all of it. Then its on to the old town of Cartagena where you can stroll through the streets at a pace that allows you to hear all the stories seeping from the colourful walls adorned with flowers before ending it all on the white sands and crystal clear waters of the Rosario Islands.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival into Bogota Airport you will be met my one of our representatives and transferred to your hotel for the evening.

There is only one way to get the most our of exploring Bogota and that is by bike. You will explore the La Candelaria, the most beautiful part of this vibrant city, including streets lined with stunning old colonial buildings, The Plaza be Bolivar and some of the most beautifully constructed churches to be found in Latin America. (B)
Its off to the Coffee region today and after a short flight you will be taken to your wonderful family run Hacienda. (B/D))

Spend the morning exploring the coffee plantations lying on the steep hillsides of this beautiful region. You will see plantations for as far as the eye can see interrupted only by fincas and heliconia flowers. Take a guided journey through a coffee plantation, learning all about the production system, including the harvest, the drying to the sun and treatment in this land of volcanic terrain along the Central Andes Mountain Range. (B/D)

Nothing showcases he beauty of this region like a trip to the mystical Valle de Cocora, part of the Parque Nacional de Los Nevados, the ideal place to see the national tree “Quindian wax palm”. You will explore cloud forests filed with hummingbirds, cross clear mountain rivers and follow an trail that allows you to take in the majesty of the surrounding scenery. On the way back you will sop in the quaint town of Salento and visits the Plaza de Bolívar, the Calle Real, the handicrafts shops and the Cocora viewpoint. (B)

From the Coffee Region to the turquoise waters of the Caribbean, you will be taken to the airport for your internal flight to Cartagena, where you will be met and taken to your hotel, nestled in the amazing old town. (B)

Today you will travel about 20 minutes to ¨La Boquilla¨, a small fishing village just outside of Cartagena where you will be able to experience the local culture of Cartagena not often seen by other tourists. Take a canoe trip through the mangrove ecosystem which is one of the most remarkable natural environments around Cartagena due to its rich fauna and diversity of vegetation. You will then have a chance to explore the little village of La Boquilla before heading back to Cartagena where you will have the afternoon free to explore on your own. (B/L)
Spend today walking lazily through the stunning old town as today is free to do as you please. (B)

About a hour off the coast of Colombia, surrounded by beautiful beaches and crystal clear waters, you will find the stunning Rosario Islands. Here you can spend the days relaxing on the beach, snorkeling along the off shore reefs teaming with wildlife or jump on a kayak and explore the island further. Simply the most beautiful place to spend the last few days in Colombia. (B)
Free days for you to enjoy this incredible archipelago. (B)
It is time to say goodbye to his wonderful country as you take the boat back to Cartagena and transferred to the airport in time for your return flight home. (B)

tourName: Colombia 20 day tour, cities to Caribbean coast
generalInfo:
Bogota - Villa de Leyva - San Gil - Salento - Medellin - Cartagena - Santa Marta - Palomino

Discover the colours of Colombia on this exciting trip, taking you through some of the amazing cities and into the jungle. Finish off your adventure soaking up some sun on one of the chilled Caribbean beaches.

You'll start your journey off in Bogota, the capital city of Colombia. Leaving its dark history behind it has turned into a bustling hot spot for travellers from all over the world. With its cobbled streets, colourful markets and beautiful plazas the city will charm you right away. You will be treated to incredible vistas of downtown Bogota during a tour of Cerro de Monserrate with your local guide.

Visit an impressive underground salt cathedral on your way to a quaint town of Villa de Leyva, where you'll spend a few days soaking in the atmosphere. Your local guide will walk you through the town and help you get acquainted with this gem. From award-winning vineyards to amazing eateries, this town has got it all!

Your next stop, San Gil, is a perfect place for the adventurous souls. Surrounded by picturesque mountains, caves and rivers (and with a handful of waterfalls to check out) this is a perfect base for your hikes as well as other activities.

You'll venture further away from the hustle and bustle of busy cities and into the nature. Time to taste that famous Colombian coffee is Salento, a charming Colombian town. While here, you'll learn everything about coffee growing during your 3-hour coffee tour, and taste some of the best locally grown coffee! You will also explore the stunning Cocora valley on a jeep, and we'd recommend venturing off on a hike for some incredible views of the valley.

From nature to culture, you'll spend a couple of days in colourful Medellin, a former home of Pablo Escobar. Things have changed here since and it's quickly turning into a trendy city. With a perfect weather all year around, it is a must see while in Colombia. You'll explore city highlights on a walk with a local resident, enjoy a cable car ride and learn a few local things!

Next, get ready to be amazed by Cartagena, one of the most beautiful cities of the Caribbean. You will explore it with a local guide, cycling through its colourful neighbourhoods and taking in its culture and history. In your free time, don't miss out on Cartagena's bustling old centre!

On your way to the well-deserved chilling spot in Palomino, you will explore Tayrona National Park. This beautiful sight where the jungle meets the beach is well worth visiting. After that, you'll reach Palomino, a lovely laid-back coastal town, and enjoy a few days of pure bliss on the Caribbean coast.

dayInfo.description: ¡Bienvenidos a Bogota!: Bogotá – Colombia’s vibrant, mountain-flanked capital has come to symbolise the country’s resurgence as a whole. Once considered one of the world’s most dangerous cities, it now welcomes visitors with open arms, and has the history, architecture and charm to be much more than just a starting point for your Colombian adventure. You’ll stay 2 nights in the colourful cobbled cultural centre – La Candelaria – filled with art, food and beautiful colonial buildings and plazas. We’ll also arrange a trip to the mountain of Monserrate with a local guide, so you can admire this great South American city from above. Much of Bogotá’s highlights are easily explored independently on foot. As with any city there are areas it’d be wise to avoid, but you’ll have no need to go to these parts. The centre is full of impressive churches, museums and narrow streets full of colourful artwork and little eateries. If you’d like to have something else arranged for your time in the city, then there’s a range of options including cycling tours, cookery classes, and art or graffiti tours – just have a chat with your Travel Specialist.

Colonial Charm in Villa de Leyva: Today you will be transferred from Bogota to Villa de Leyva with stops along the way at the Zipaquirá salt cathedral and Raquira (total travel time 6 hours). On your way north from Bogota you’ll visit the incredible underground salt cathedral at Zipaquirá with a private guide, before arriving into Villa De Leyva – a cobbled colonial gem where you can get a glimpse into Colombia’s distant past. With a mild climate, peaceful hilly surroundings and plenty of great places to eat and drink, Villa De Leyva provides a welcome break after bustling Bogota, and you’ll be spending a couple of days here. The following day, we’ll arrange a walking tour with a local guide for you to get acquainted with this small but interesting village. There are some great museums showing remnants of the area’s history, as well as an award-winning vineyard, a bizarre terracotta house and even an archaeological site on the outskirts which is home to many ‘fertility’ statues. The evening is free for you to stroll through the cobbled streets and plazas, taking in the tranquil atmosphere and picking out one of the many quality restaurants for your evening meal.

Pura Vida in San Gil:In the morning you will be picked up at your hotel in Villa de Leyva and your private driver will take you to San Gil in around four hours. The small town has a lively centre where you can make yourself comfortable in the shade of a tree on a park bench and watch the goings-on in the plaza. You will spend the next two nights in a small, family-run hotel, which is located near the Rio Fonce and the central square. The rooms are comfortable and the hosts are warm and attentive with great knowledge of the local area. Today it is time to learn the kinds of activities and adventures that nature lovers and the adventurous can experience in San Gil. In the area there are huge mountains, thundering waterfalls, numerous caves and rivers with strong currents. These features make San Gil a paradise for the adventurous, whether its paragliding, mountain biking or hiking that takes our interest. If you decide you want even more adventure around San Gil, extend your stay to include a trip to Barichara – one of the prettiest villages in the whole country.

Bogota - overnight hotel: Today you’ll take a bus from San Gil to Bogota – a journey of approx 7 hours. Tonight you will head back to Bogota and spend another night in La Candelaria, an area you’re starting to know well, before continuing your tour the next day.

Sky-high Trees and Steaming Coffees: Today you’ll travel to Armenia by bus or domestic flight and from there you will be taken to Salento by private transfer. The journey takes about an hour, and when you get there you’ll be able to enjoy your first cup of delicious local coffee. You’ll spend three nights in a colourful accommodation with Colombian flair that’s conveniently situated for you to be able to walk to the main square with many bars and restaurants. During your stay, you’ll head out on three-hour coffee tour, where you’ll learn all there is to know about growing and selling the best coffee in the world. Colombia exports the majority of its best beans, so the plantation that you’ll visit is a great place to taste the best this region has to offer. No trip to this region is complete without a visit to the famous Cocora valley, so we’ll also organise a ticket for a return trip in a classic “Willys” jeep. Once in the valley, you can walk directly to the sky-high wax palms, or you go through a gate to the right and take a beautiful 4-5 hour hike over hills with stunning views of the valley.

Eternal Spring in Medellin: Today you will take the bus from Armenia to Medellin – a journey of approx 6 hours. With a seemingly ever-pleasant climate and a stunning location surrounded by steep hills and jagged peaks, Medellín is quickly shaking off its infamous past to become one of Colombia’s must-visit cities. You’ll find a character and fast-paced attitude which sets the city apart from the rest of the nation, and it can be a lot of fun to be a part of for a few days! You’ll spend 2 nights in a comfortable hotel in the trendy El Poblado district, with a host of restaurants and bars nearby. On your second day you’ll take a tour with a local paisa (Medellín resident) guide who’ll show you the ins and outs (and highs and lows) of their city, including the cable cars which connect downtown with the neighbourhoods high up in the hills, and give a spectacular view of the city. You’ll also see the Botero statues, and some lesser-known highlights, before you’re left to explore, relax, or maybe experience a little of the city’s famous party scene!

The Queen of the Caribbean: Today, you’ll take a transfer to the airport and jump on a flight from Medellin to Cartagena. On arrival in Cartagena you’ll quickly understand why this is seen as the most beautiful colonial city in Colombia. Your charming accommodation is in the historic city centre, just a few minutes from the beach and all the main sights. The old town is a bit touristy, but its beauty means it’s a UNESCO World Heritage Site consisting of a labyrinth of small alleys and many squares. Check out the historic centre in the district of El Centro. Otherwise known as “The Walled City”, it’s here that you’ll find a thick wall fortification and colonial buildings that date back centuries. For your second day in Cartagena, you’ll have a half day bike tour planned. Together with a guide you will get to know more about the history of Cartagena. You’ll explore the neighbourhoods of Getsemaní, Manga and Bocagrande, passing well-known sights and stopping at various places to learn more, from your guide, about the cultural and historical aspects of Cartagena that many people miss out on. The rest of your time here is free to do as you please. There is a lot to discover just by strolling through the streets, watching the hustle and bustle and enjoying the cafes and local street food.

Santa Marta - overnight hotel: Today you will take the shuttle bus from Cartagena to Santa Marta – a journey of approx 4 hours. Tonight you will stay overnight in a hotel in Santa Marta, which is a perfect stopover on your way along the Caribbean Coast and a beautiful city in its own right. Depending on what time you arrive, you can go for a walk through the old city centre trying some delicious street food or stroll along the beach.

Caribbean Paradise of Palomino: This morning you’ll be picked up from your hotel in Santa Marta and transferred to Tayrona National Park, one of Colombia’s well-known highlights. Here the tropical rainforest runs right up to the beach, the water is clear, the sand is soft and the palm trees are metres high. Entrance fees are included. After time to explore, your driver will take you to Palomino. Palomino doesn’t seem like much as you drive along the main road, but you’ll start to feel that Caribbean holiday vibe pretty quickly. Sandwiched between the Caribbean Sea and the snow-capped mountains of the Sierra Nevada, the laid-back beach village of Palomino has slowly developed into a popular stop-off for travellers who make it as far as Colombia’s north-east coast. It’s easy to see why, with a dreamy location and just enough good places to stay, eat and drink to keep you blissfully satisfied for a few days. You’ll stay 3 nights in a small-scale resort just outside the village overlooking the beach, and can spend your days relaxing under palm trees, tubing down the jungle-flanked river or swimming in the warm sea. On your last day you’ll be transferred from Palomino to Santa Marta Airport. This will take approx 2 hours.

placesVisited: Bogota, Gold Museum, La Candalaria, Monseratte, Paloquemao Market, Zipaquira Salt Cathedral, The Observatory, Internal flight to Armenia, Manziales, Santa Fe de Antioquia, Medellin, Internal flight to Santa Marta, Tayrona National Park, Volcan de Lodo El Totumo, Jungle trekking, Cartagena, Wih, Pipes, Between
generalInfo:
Head off-piste with a Colombia adventure holiday that will reawaken your passion for travel and showcase a country that has shaken off a troubled past to focus on its natural and historic attractions.

From the capital, Bogota, with its Gold Museum and stunning hilltop look-out, Monseratte, you’ll head to the fascinating Salt Cathedral of Ziapquira, an underground Roman Catholic church that has been intricately carved into the tunnels of a salt mine. Flying into Armenia, you’ll arrive in the very heart of Colombia’s legendary coffee plantation district, to stay in a traditional hacienda. Using it as a base, you can enjoy hiking or horse trekking through the Manizales region, as well as visit Santa Fe de Antioquia, the oldest settlement in the country.

You’ll spend a day in the dynamic city of Medellin, now well-known for its amazing nightlife and cuisine, before flying on to Santa Marta on Colombia’s idyllic Caribbean coast. Here you’ll do some atmospheric jungle trekking, and naturally there will be time set aside so you can reward yourself stretching out on relax on the white sand beaches of Tayrona National Park.

The trip finishes in the colonial city of Cartagena, but before your small group heads off in their own separate ways there will be a visit to one final landmark – the Volcan de Lodo El Totumo, a volcano that erupts mud instead of lava. It’s great for your skin, so feel free to jump into the mud pools.

dayInfo.description: Tours starts in Bogota: For anyone arriving on the group flights which arrive into Bogota in the early morning we’ll provide a couple of “wash & change” rooms with breakfast until official check-in at 15:00 this afternoon. For everyone else, the tour will officially start mid-morning at the hotel from where we’ll set off on a gentle introduction to Colombia’s capital which will include the dazzling Gold Museum which houses one of the finest collections anywhere in the world.

Bogota: We’ll have the full day to enjoy the many sights that Bogota has to offer including La Candelaria, Bogota’s oldest suburb, which boasts dozens of fine colonial buildings, churches and museums, including the Botero Museum. Here we can see the works of art by Fernando Botero, Colombia's most famous artist whose "oversized" art is instantly recognisable. We will also visit Paloquemao market, the second largest in the city as well as the hilltop look-out and monastery of Monserrate. This evening will be free for you to discover the culinary delights of the Colombia capital.

Bogota – Honda: This morning we will drive to Zipaquira where we will visit the spectacular underground Salt Cathedral. The salt mines house an eerie and magnificent spectacle carved out directly from the rock salt. The cavernous cathedral, consists of a labyrinth of tunnels and chambers and can hold an impressive 8400 people. After a tour of the cathedral we’ll continue on to the picturesque riverside town of Honda which is renowned for its colonial architecture and 40 bridges. This journey takes us from the heights of the Eastern Andean range and Bogota plateau down to the hotter and more sultry weather of the Magdalena River basin. Driving distance 224km, 6 hours approx.

Honda - Manizales (Coffee Region): We’ll have time this morning to discover the charms of the so-called ‘city of bridges’. Sitting astride the Magdalena River, Honda was once an important port during the colonial era but went on to lose its economic significance when transportation routes changed. Now part of the Network of Heritage Towns of Colombia, Honda is slowly (very slowly) being rediscovered again. Later we’ll head westwards and back up into the mountains on the central Andean chain as we make for the country’s famed coffee region. We will reach a whopping 3,650m along the epic Alto de Letras mountain pass and will no doubt be able to witness a brave cyclist or few tackling it on two wheels. Dropping down into Manizales, the spectacular scenery won't end there with a cable car ride affording panoramic views across the city. Our base for the next two nights is only a 30-minute drive yet the rural, working coffee farm is a world away! Driving distance 153km, 4.5 hours approx.

Manizales (Coffee Region): This morning we’ll get to see the workings of a coffee plantations as we see the whole process from seedling to coffee cup and every part in between. We’ll learn about the trials and tribulations that face the coffee growers and how their whole way of life is affected by this simple bean - your life as a coffee drinker will never be the same, once you have tasted the elixir of life from Colombia! However coffee is not the only bean of importance in Colombia as the country is home to some of the finest cocoa found anywhere on the planet. That fact alone should be sufficient reason for any avid chocoholics to place it at the top of their to-do list and this afternoon will be dedicated to learning more about the cultivation of this beloved crop. There will be an opportunity to see the plantations themselves, the raw cocoa fruit and all-important bean as well as the processes used to turn this into our beloved chocolate.

Manizales - Salamina: Heading north from Manizales we avoid the main road to Medellin and instead take a quieter backroad which traverses some truly spectacular scenery and allows us access to the lesser visited northern coffee region. It is just a short drive to Finca La Romelia, a local farm belonging to the Londoño family for over a century. Today it is home to a collection of over 6,000 different orchid plants, including the Cattleya or Christmas Orchid - the national flower of Colombia. Wandering through the vast property, we will also be on the lookout for woodpeckers, tanagers, hummingbirds and the like. There are recordings of some 200 different species of birdlife around the property. After a spot of lunch, we will continue to the colonial hilltop gem of Salamina for an orientation tour of this historic town's steep streets.

Salamina - San Felix - Aguadas: From the nearby village of San Felix, we will swap our minibus for a jeep in order to reach an area rich with some of the highest and most extensive swathes of wax palms in the entire country. The wax palm has become a national symbol and with some reaching upwards of 200ft it is the world’s tallest palm tree. We'll learn more about these impressive species as we take a walk around the breath-taking forest. Making our way back to San Felix, we will continue our journey along the backroads of the northern coffee region to Aguadas. This equally picturesque colonial town is not only part of the UNESCO listed coffee culture landscape but is also a famed centre for local handicrafts. As such, this afternoon we’ll have the opportunity to observe the skills involved in the making of the traditional aguadeño hat, a treasured symbol of the region made using fibres from the locally grown iraca palm. Later there’ll be time to explore the tranquil streets of the old town and to meet the friendly locals, for whom foreign visitors are still a relative rarity.

Aguadas - Medellin: A morning’s drive takes us to Medellin, known for its nightlife, lively culture and friendliness. On arrival we’ll take an orientation tour highlighting the incredible changes this city, whose name was once synonymous with drug cartels, has undergone in the last few years. Surrounded by mountain peaks, the city offers stunning scenery and, is known as the “City of Eternal Spring”. We’ll take the metro into the city centre to visit and wander amongst Botero sculptures in Parque Berrio. Although static works of art, we can watch the local Colombians climbing all over them and interacting with the sculptures the way Botero intended. The sculptures also include the pajaro de paz or ‘bird of peace’ sculpture, ironically damaged by a bomb by the insurgents and a reminder that Medellin was not always the trendy cosmopolitan hub it is today. Driving distance 154km, 4 hours approx.

Medellin: A full day in Medellin enables time to gain a greater appreciation for this fascinating city. We’ll start off by taking the outdoor escalators up the hill to the outer limits of the city and this bird’s eye view looking down on Medellin will help to put the entire city in to perspective. Once these barrios, or neighbourhoods, were no-go areas for even the police, but the city’s revival and revolutionary transport system has opened the city up to social and economic development in even the poorest parts. There is an immense pride in these local barrios and there will be opportunities to see a flourishing urban art and music scene, and to interact with the locals of Comuna 13 to get a better understanding of how these parts of the city tick and now contribute to Medellin’s vibrant cultural fabric. After lunch you’ll be free to head to explore more of this city for yourself, perhaps heading for the lively Parque lllaeras to see the hip and trendy of Medellin strut their stuff.

Medellin – Santa Marta: Today will be very much dependent on flight schedules and, as such, we may move around activities in Medellin should there be time for further exploration.
