After breakfast, return to Bogotá. On the way, stop at the Convento del Santo Ecce Homo. Founded by the Dominicans in 1620, this was an important point of evangelisation in a region populated by indigenous communities. The tour ends at your hotel in Bogotá and the rest of the day is free for you to explore at your leisure. Meal plan: Breakfast

In the morning, transfer to the airport in Bogotá for your flight to Neiva. Arrive at Neiva airport, where you will be met by a local guide, and head north to visit the town of Villavieja and the Palaeontological Museum. Then, visit the surreal, lunar-esque Tatacoa Desert, crossing crevasses eroded by wind and water. The trip continues 217 km to the south over a paved road until you reach San Agustín. This scenic journey provides beautiful views of the extensive floodplains of the Magdalena River valley from at heights ranging from 700 metres to 1,730 metres above sea level. After a journey of approximately 6 hours, arrive in San Agustin and check in to the hotel. Meal plan: Breakfast

Morning visit to San Agustín Archaeological Park, designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1995. See the ceremonial Fuente de Lavapatas before heading up the hill to the Lavapatas terrace, from which you can enjoy remarkable views over the surrounding countryside. Pay a visit the small Museo Arqueológico to learn more about the history of the site and ongoing conservation efforts. Afterwards, visit the wonderful Colombian massif and the source of the Magadalena River, a spectacular rocky gorge that forces the river to pass through a gap of just 2.2 metres. Return to the hotel. Meal plan: breakfast

After breakfast, depart on an approximately 5-hour unpaved transfer to Popayán, the capital of the department of Cauca. Enjoy the journey surrounded by the Andean scenery of picturesque mountains and high-altitude plains. Upon arrival, embark on a half-day visit to the historic centre of Popayán, concentrating on Parque Caldas. Around the Parque Caldas are the main religious and government buildings, as well as the city’s original buildings such as the Torre del Reloj, considered one of the symbols of the city, built between 1673 and 1682 and set in 1737. Continue towards the Puente de Humilladero, built in 1873 to facilitate access from the city centre to El Callejón (currently Barrio Bolívar), particularly for those pilgrims making the journey on their knees. The Morro de Tulcán, Popayán’s main archaeological site, is next and comprises a pre-Columbian truncated pyramid. Visit the Iglesia de Santo Domingo, a baroque-style church designed by the Spanish architect Antonio García and commissioned by the Arboleda family, and the Iglesia de San Francisco, considered the most beautiful baroque church in town. Visit the Museo de Arte Religioso, which houses an interesting collection of religious art. Meal plan: Breakfast

Half-day visit to the small town of Silvia, located in a temperate mountainous area near Popayán and consisting of picturesque houses surrounded by vast sugar cane plantations. The indigenous Guambiano community with a population of 12,000 inhabitants lives in small mountain villages nearby. Every Tuesday, on market day, the village of Silvia is transformed into a colorful, bustling and picturesque place when the Guambiano indigenous people descend upon Silvia dressed in their traditional 'anacos', a blue knee-length skirt-like wraparound to sell, fruit, vegetables and handicrafts. Return to Popayán and the rest of the day is free for you to explore at your own pace. Meal plan: Breakfast

After breakfast, begin a 6-hour drive north to Pereira, through rolling countryside and traditional towns. On arrival at your accommodation in the coffee region, you will check-in and have the rest of the day at leisure. Meal plan: Breakfast

After breakfast, leave for the Valle de Cocora in the central mountains of the department of Quindío. Upon arrival in the valley, either hiking or on horseback (not included), head into the cloud forest to enjoy the biodiversity of flora and fauna. On the return journey, cross the River Quindío while walking along an ecological pathway that takes you past the tallest wax palms in the world. Learn why the indigenous people here worshipped this tree. Then enjoy a typical lunch and enjoy some free time here. In the afternoon, continue 10 km towards the traditional town of Salento to enjoy a tour that visits the Plaza de Bolívar with its colourful balconies, the Calle Real, the handicrafts shops and the Cocora viewpoint. Then, transfer to the village of Filandia to enjoy a tour that includes a viewpoint, colonial homes, the Plaza de Bolívar and the coffee shops. Here, enjoy some time soaking up the regional atmosphere and perhaps some local spirits before returning to the hotel. Meal plan: Breakfast & lunch

Half-day visit to the Finca del Café, a place where coffee tastes better when you live the experience of the farm! On arrival, an expert guide will take you through the coffee production process, beginning with the planting, manual picking and pulping. After this, you will toast coffee beans in a wood stove in a typical farmhouse kitchen. During the tour, you will come to several viewpoints from which you can appreciate the verdant coffee landscape. Finally, learn about the innovative drying process of the coffee bean, then visit the coffee processing centre. This tour includes three cups of freshly roasted coffee, from beans cultivated at the Finca del Café. The rest of the day is at leisure. Meal plan: Breakfast

After breakfast, you'll be transferred from hotel to the airport in Pereira, flown direct to Medellín, then promptly transferred to your hotel there. The rest of the day is your own to explore this rejuvenated city. Meal plan: Breakfast

After breakfast, we begin a half-day tour to visit the areas of Medelli´n that best represent the city's radical social transformation over the last 20 years. In the 1980s and '90s, Medelli´n was one of the most dangerous cities in the world, with the notorious drug lord, Pablo Escobar, and his Medelli´n Cartel, operating at their peak. With his death in 1993, the reign of 'El Patro´n' came to an end, but it took until 2002 for the city to start seeing real changes, when the government began to invest heavily in infrastructure and public education. Nowadays, the 'City of Eternal Spring' is one of the most innovative metropolises in the world. Visit the barrio San Javier, which used to be one of the most unsafe suburbs of Medelli´n. Located 7 km from the city centre, it is an excellent example of the social transformation that has taken place over the last few years. Arrive here by the Metrocable that joins the north-east area with the city centre, the installation of which has been life- changing for many of the inhabitants of Medelli´n. Learn more about the city’s transformation after the death of Pablo Escobar and explore Medellin’s newest invention: the outdoor escalators in the Comuna 13 district. Discover stories about the district's past by visiting the most important places marked by historical events and see graffiti that acts as a form of artistic expression for the community. Bask in the beautiful cityscape views from San Javier. Then, continue to La Plazoleta (renamed Plaza Botero) located in the city centre. This area fell into decline in the 1980s but today houses 23 sculptures by Fernando Botero. The artist donated the sculptures to the city in 2000 and thus contributed to the cultural transformation of the city. After the tour, feel free to explore Medelli´n at your own pace. Meal plan: Breakfast

Today, you head to the town of Guatapé to visit the enormous El Peñol rock. The journey to El Peñol takes around two hours, during which you will have time to appreciate the outstanding landscape of Antioquia. Visit the picturesque village of Guatapé where all of the houses are painted in quaint pastel colours and after lunch, visit the Guatapé reservoir, with a 30-minute boat tour. For those who wish to climb El Peñol for outstanding views, there will be time for this before returning to Medellin. Meal plan: Breakfast & lunch

Medellin is well known for its pleasant climate and annual flower festival. Just an hour away is Santa Elena, a small town from which the silleteros hail. These master florists are responsible for the symbolic annual silleteros' parade, the main event at the festival. The most important tradition for them is the production of silletas (chairs) with flowers grown in their own gardens. The word silleta goes back to colonial times, when the Spanish nobles were carried by native Indians on their backs using a wooden structure shaped like a chair. This tradition continues to this day, but to carry produce rather than people. The tour begins early, passing along the Corredor de Las Palmas, the main highway to the international airport. En route, visit a typical craft market to appreciate the local handicrafts, or to taste regional delicacies. On arrival in Santa Elena we’ll visit an authentic flower farm, where you will have the opportunity to meet local farmers and connoisseurs of the silleteros art. Please keep in mind that this is a rural area and roads to plantations aren’t always paved. Transfer to Medelli´n airport to catch a flight to Cartagena. On your arrival in Cartagena, you will be met by a Travel The Unknown representative and transferred to your hotel. Check-in and enjoy an evening to roam in this iconic Caribbean city. Meal plan: Breakfast

Begin your half-day city tour with panoramic views of the city from the Convento de La Popa. Continue to the Castillo San Felipe and walk around the fortress, learning about the castle's construction, the feats of engineering to build it, the tunnels, underground galleries and passageways. Then, continue to the Ciudad Vieja (old city) to visit the Convent and Church of the San Pedro Claver compound, built in the 17th century. Lastly, head to Bovedas, a collection of archways built into Cartagena's city walls and used until the end of the 18th century to house armaments, then later as a prison. Nowadays, it’s an artisan centre where handicrafts can be browsed and purchased. The afternoon is free for you to explore Cartagena at your own pace. Meal plan: Breakfast

Free morning to explore more of Cartagena as you wish. Mid/late afternoon, transfer to airport for your flight back to Bogota and connect with your onward flight. Alternatively, join us for an optional extension to Tayrona or elsewhere in Colombia. Contact us for options. Meal plan: Breakfast

placesVisited: Bogota, Gold Museum, La Candelaria, Museo Botero, Paloquemao Market, Take the cable car up Monserrate, Popaya, Silvia Market, Armenia, Stay in a hacienda, Salento, Tour a coffee farm, Pijao, Medellin, Cartagena, Guatape, 2025 itinerary includes more of Colombia's central zone: Villa de Leyva, Barichara, Guane, and Chicamocha National Park
generalInfo:
This two-week small group tour of Colombia takes you from Bogota to Cartagena, via Armenia and Medellin. It's an immersive tour that's designed to show people how Colombia has evolved since the notorious days of Escobar, as well as illuminating the country’s rich Indigenous history. You will stay in small, often locally owned accommodations, flying conveniently between destinations, and touring key landmarks that rightly feature on any Colombia itinerary.

Exciting updates to this tour recently include visiting more of Colombia's beautiful central zone, like the underground salt cathedral at Zipaquira and the beautiful landscape of Chicamocha National Park.

In Bogota, wander the balconied houses in the La Candelaria neighbourhood, and the vibrant flower stalls of the Paloquemao farmers’ market, before admiring the capital from above with a cable car journey up Mt. Monserrate. In Paloquemao, visit the market where farmers sell stacks of tropical fruit. A big highlight is Armenia, which is among Colombia’s most picturesque regions, surrounded by Andean peaks. You’ll tour a working coffee farm here, and have the opportunity to stay in a beautiful old hacienda. Medellin is a fascinating city, regenerating masterfully despite the scars of recent history, and a cultural dynamo.

After two memorable weeks on the road, the trip comes to an end in Cartagena, its old town a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a historic city where the streets are always alive with music and dance – this beautiful city makes relaxing end to a trip that will no doubt stay with you for years to come.

dayInfo.title: Join trip in Bogota
dayInfo.description: : Arrive in Bogota, the capital of Colombia set at an altitude of over 2,600m. The city sprawls out from the high ranges of the Cordillera Mountains, blanketing the Andean peaks with an eclectic mix of historic buildings and modern, urban architecture. Its name comes from the Muisca indigenous people who inhabited the region before the arrival of the Spaniards in 1538, and the remnants of not only the Muisca empire but of Colombia's many other indigenous cultures can be found in the city's impressive Gold Museum. For those arriving on time our Leader plans to meet you in the hotel reception at 6pm for the welcome meeting and for those that wish, there is the chance to go out for dinner. There are no activities planned today, so you are free to arrive in Bogota at any time. If you would like to receive a complimentary airport transfer today, you'll need to arrive into Bogota's El Dorado International Airport (airport code: BOG), approximately a 45 minute drive from our hotel. Should you miss the meeting, your leader will inform you of any essential information as soon as you catch up. If your flight arrives earlier in the day, La Candelaria is a good place to orientate yourself in the city, where a wealth of museums, bars and restaurants are dotted in between colonial convents and churches.

dayInfo.title: Taste the fruits at Paloquemao farmers market; explore the city on foot
dayInfo.description: : This morning we spend time exploring the city, first delving into local life with a visit to the farmers market at Paloquemao, with its overwhelming array of smells and colours. Our Tour Leader will introduce us to some of the tropical fruits on offer here, as we speak to some of the different sellers. From the market, we visit the Gold Museum; while many cities in Latin America have their own 'Museo de Oro', Bogota's is widely regarded as housing the region's finest collection of gold from pre-Hispanic times. The museum's star exhibit is the Muisca Raft - an impressive piece of pre-Colombian artistry that fueled the Spaniard's search for El Dorado. From the museum we'll walk to the colourful colonial streets of La Candelaria for a traditional Colombian lunch at one of the city's many restaurants - it's an opportunity to try the popular dish Ajiaco Santafereno, which is a hearty soup made from chicken, potato and corn. It's found throughout Colombia but is particularly popular in Bogota. After lunch we continue our exploration on foot. Walking under the balconied houses from where local residents often observe the comings and goings below, we'll encounter some excellent examples of colonial architecture, such as the Catedral Primada de Colombia. The visit continues with the Museo Botero, a colonial house filled with works of art by the Colombian artist and sculptor Fernando Botero, famous for his abstract portrayal of people with large, exaggerated proportions. Our city tour ends at around 5pm.

dayInfo.title: Cable car up Mount Monserrate; drive to Villa de Leyva via the Zipaquira Salt Cathedral
dayInfo.description: : We take a birds eye view of the city this morning, as we ascend Mount Monserrate by cable car. On top of the mountain there is a church, whose statue of Senor Caido, the 'Fallen Christ', has become a pilgrimage location for the locals. If weather conditions allow you should be rewarded with fine views across the city and the countryside beyond. After our descent in the cable car, we depart the city, driving north to the Salt Cathedral at Zipaquira. This immense wonder was created by the salt miners, whose Catholic religion still necessitated a place to pray. Carved out of solid salt, the structure can accommodate over 8000 people and we'll find statues and the signs of the cross etched in salt as we walk through the vast chambers. After some time for lunch, we continue our drive to the charming little town of Villa de Leyva. Founded in 1574, this town is one of Colombia's colonial treasures. Nestled in the Andean foothills where time seems to have almost stood still, it was declared a national monument in 1954. It is easy to see why Villa de Leyva's local residents have been keen to preserve the thriving heart of this old town. Cobbled streets thread their way between whitewashed buildings and the colonial architectural style, with wood framed windows and balconies laden with flowers and plants. It is a delight to behold. We'll arrive at the hotel at approximately 5pm this afternoon. The drive from Bogota to Villa de Leyva is approximately 145 kilometres / 90 miles and will take around three hours, not including the stop at the Salt Cathedral.

dayInfo.title: Find pre-Columbian and colonial history in the surroundings of Villa de Leyva; free afternoon
dayInfo.description: : We'll drive out into the foothills of the Andes to explore the local area with our guide today, first driving to 'El Infiernito' at the Zaquencipa Archaelogical Park. This pre-Columbian site was used by the Muisca people as an astronomical observatory and a place of worship. It's home to thirty stone monoliths, and we'll learn how the ingenious Muisca people used the site to plan harvest seasons and planting times. We'll then continue to the Convent of Santo Ecce Homo, which was founded by Dominican Monks in 1620. The convent marks an important moment in the history of the region, as it accelerated a period of evangelization in a region populated by the 'infidel' indigenous communities. We'll drive out into the foothills of the Andes to explore the local area with our guide today, first driving to 'El Infiernito' at the Zaquencipa Archaelogical Park. This pre-Columbian site was used by the Muisca people as an astronomical observatory and a place of worship. It's home to thirty stone monoliths, and we'll learn how the ingenious Muisca people used the site to plan harvest seasons and planting times. We'll then continue to the Convent of Santo Ecce Homo, which was founded by Dominican Monks in 1620. The convent marks an important moment in the history of the region, as it accelerated a period of evangelization in a region populated by the 'infidel' indigenous communities. We also drive to Pozos Azules for a quick viewpoint stop. These artificial pools are created by an accumulation of rainwater and minerals that, particularly in sunny weather, transform into a startling blue and green colour, which contrasts with the surrounding arid landscape to make them appear like oases in a desert. After returning to Villa de Leyva for lunch, we'll take the afternoon free to soak up the towns peaceful charm. You might wish to take the 30 minute walk to the odd 'Terracotta House', a completely unique architect-built house on the outskirts of Villa de Leyva, or take a longer walk to 'El Mirador del Cristo', from where you'll have a fantastic view of the whole town. Alternatively, Villa de Leyva is home to many artists, artisans and museums to spend a relaxed afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Drive to the pretty town of Barichara via Socorro
dayInfo.description: : In the morning, we depart further north; the central part of Colombia that separates Bogota from the Caribbean is littered with intensely pretty towns with terracotta roofs and winding cobbled roads. Our end destination is thought to be the prettiest in all Colombia - Barichara. Its white-washed houses with colourful doors and wrought-iron balconies are a distinct contrast from the metropolitan cities of Bogota and Medellin. En route to Barichara, we'll make a stop at Socorro. This small unassuming town has a big place in Colombia's history - it's known as the 'Cradle of Liberty', for its role as the town where the first uprising against Spanish rule occurred, and where the steps towards Colombia's independence began. We'll just take a short stroll around the town to stretch our legs and see the sights, including the enormous stone-built cathedral, and depending on the timings will most likely make this town our lunch stop We'll then continue to Barichara and have the rest of the afternoon to take in this charming colonial town. The total drive time to Barichara is approximately five hours.

dayInfo.title: Walk the Camino Real (Royal Road) to Guane; afternoon 'rammed earth' workshop with local architect
dayInfo.description: : The easy hike from Barichara to Guane takes in part of the Camino Real, or 'Royal Road' - a cobblestone path that dates back hundreds of years, connecting the area's farmlands. This postcard-pretty walk leads us through Colombia's peaceful countryside, through meadows and tree-lined corridors, with the Andes ever-present in the background. The beauty of this 6 kilometre (3.5 mile) walk is that from Barichara it is almost entirely downhill. With time to admire the views, it should take around two hours, possibly three depending on our speed. Walking downhill on stone paths and steps may be tough for people with knee problems, and you may wish to bring walking poles along with you. In Guane we'll have a break to visit the small village museum, before jumping in a rickshaw or one of the colourful chiva buses and heading back up to Barichara. For those who don't wish to do the walk, Barichara has plenty of charm to enjoy a leisurely morning. In the afternoon, we'll have a fascinating experience at a rammed earth workshop, led by the architect Santiago Rivero. Most houses in Barichara and the surrounding area are made by this centuries-old technique, using a low-cost material - earth - that makes house-building accessible to all. Many of the buildings here are older than 300-years old. Rivero is trying to protect the history of the town and keep this tradition alive - our workshop will have some hands-on elements and help us to appreciate the significance of why these charming towns look the way they do.

dayInfo.title: Drive into Chicamocha National Park; cable car ride across the canyon; fly to the coffee region
dayInfo.description: : We drive to Bucaramanga Airport this morning, but before leaving Colombia's beautiful central zone we'll head into Chicamocha National Park, home to one of the country's most astounding natural wonders. With peaks and valleys extending into the distance, the vast canyon claims to be one of the largest in the world. We'll take an exciting cable car ride down into the canyon and up the other side, with panoramic views from all sides. Continuing the scenic drive, we'll head to Hacienda el Roble for our included lunch (not included, payable locally). This old colonial house is a coffee hacienda with a number of rooms and a restaurant on site, all surrounded by superb grounds. We'll try authentic local cuisine here during our lunch, and of course have the chance to try the coffee. We continue from the hacienda to Bucaramanga Airport, and fly to Armenia via Bogota. If direct flights become available we will of course take those as a preference. Armenia is the capital of the Quindío department, an important coffee growing centre in the foothills of the Andes range. Immediately on leaving the airport, we'll drive to our hotel located about 30 minutes away, arriving in the late evening. This old, characterful hacienda has views out to the Quindío valley, which we will be exploring over the next 2 days.

dayInfo.title: Cooking class with a Colombian chef; tour a coffee plantation and taste the local brew
dayInfo.description: : Colombia is renowned for its excellent food, with regional specialties in almost every different town, from Bandeja Paisa (basically the Colombian equivalent of a full English breakfast, but with plantain, avocado, cornbread, delicious frijoles and heaps of different meats) to pandebono, a traditional bread made with cheese, frequently served with guava paste. Today we'll be getting stuck into the gastronomy with a cooking class at our own hacienda. A local chef here will help us to prepare 'sancocho', a typical Colombian soup that is stuffed full of vegetables, yuca, corn, plantain and either chicken, fish or beef. It is frequently eaten with avocado and white rice on the side. We'll make this together, alongside some other tasty appetizers and drinks, which we eat together for lunch. Our hacienda here in coffee country happens to be surrounded by its own coffee farm. We'll spend the afternoon visiting the farm, learning about the whole process from the planting of the beans all the way through the picking and roasting process, finishing off with trying the fresh coffee. The physical work undertaken by the pickers in hauling their loads across the mountainside is quite amazing. If, for any reason, the hotel changes, we will visit one of the other many coffee farms in this area.

dayInfo.title: Full day exploring the wax palms of the Cocora Valley; traditional lunch in colonial Salento
dayInfo.description: : After breakfast we take a drive to Salento, where we climb aboard an immaculately restored vintage Willys jeep and drive into the Cocora Valley. We're in the foothills of the Andes here, hiking amongst a multitude of towering wax palms that pepper the mountainside like pins in a cushion. These countryside walks are on undulating terrain with well-trodden paths and our walk will take approximately two hours. Before leaving the Cocora Valley, we'll have a typical lunch with views of the mountains. Trout is particular to the area, usually served with plantain and rice, but you may also find yuca and arepas too. On our return to Salento, we'll play an explosive round of Colombia's national game - Tejo. This bizarre sport involved players lobbing tejos (metal discs) towards a metal ring in a sandpit that is loaded with gunpowder-filled pieces. The aim? Explosion! This lively bowls-like game is best played with a beer and a sense of fun. After the game, we'll have some time free to explore charming Salento town, its colourful architecture so characteristic of this coffee growing region, before driving back to our hacienda in the Quindio Valley.

dayInfo.title: Scenic drive to Medellin
dayInfo.description: : This morning, we'll drive north to Medellin, known as the 'City of Eternal Spring' due to its temperate year-round climate. It's a full day of driving today so we plan to leave early, with the aim to arrive into Medellin in the mid afternoon, allowing for some free time in this charming city. The drive will take around seven hours, including stops.

dayInfo.title: Flower Festival day in Medellin
dayInfo.description: : As one of the largest flower producers in the world (second only to the Netherlands), Colombia puts all its heart into this annual festival, bringing some of the country's biggest growers together for weeks of events and celebrations. The schedule for the annual celebration changes yearly, and our plan for the day will depend on what events are going on. There are a wide range of traditional and modern events, some related to flowers and some music, dance or other cultural showcases. The whole city is decorated at this time with flower displays and vibrant decoration, and the atmosphere is lively and fun. In the evening we will have a celebratory dinner in Medellin.

dayInfo.title: Explore Medellin on foot and by cable car; fly to Cartagena on the Caribbean Coast
dayInfo.description: : We'll spend our final morning here discovering Medellin's past and present with a local guide. We'll travel by private transport, on foot and by cable car, including the outlying suburban area of Comuna 13. The tour aims to give the historical perspective behind Pablo Escobar's residency in Medellin, including what it was like when he was alive, and the changes that have made it the modern and diverse city it is today. We'll see the infamous rooftop where Pablo met his end, and the Casa de la Memoria Museum, an initiative started by the victims of the drug traffic trade that contributed to overcoming the conflict in Medellin. We will also visit the Parque Memorial la Inflexion, built where the Monaco building, Escobar's property, was located until its demolition in 2019. There were as many as 46,000 victims of narcotraffico in Colombia, and this park was built in their memory. This tour isn't designed to glorify Escobar's lasting imprint on the city, but to memorialise the people affected by the drug trade and to celebrate the modern face of Medellin. In the afternoon, we will travel to the airport and fly to Cartagena on the shores of Colombia's Caribbean Sea. Depending on the flight schedules, we should arrive at around 6 or 7pm (schedules may change), and in the evening we may have chance to see a little of the cobblestone streets and colonial convents of the old walled town.

dayInfo.title: Free time in Cartagena; evening sunset and dinner at the seaside hub of La Boquilla
dayInfo.description: : Cartagena's beauty is well-documented throughout history. In recent times, the writer Gabriel Garcia Marquez put it at the fore of Colombian culture by using it as the setting for many of his novels, including the famous 'Love in the Time of Cholera'. The massive fortified walls around the old city, dating back several hundred years, helped with the designation of the city as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It's a wonderful place to get 'lost' in, with old plazas and churches galore, as well as plenty of cafes, restaurants, markets and a warm, welcoming atmosphere around every corner. We're free to explore today. For those who wish to go outside the city walls, you may want to take a taxi ride to visit the hilltop convent of Santa Cruz de la Popa, with its spectacular panoramic views of the city, or the 16th-century fortress of San Felipe. For bird lovers, there is also the option to visit the National Aviary of Colombia, an enormous natural complex located a one-hour drive outside of the city. In the early evening, we'll take a short drive out to nearby La Boquilla. Now an offshoot of Cartagena itself, this one-time fishing village still has a hint of its past and the residents balance their fishing heritage with tourism. There are fantastic sunsets from here, and we'll have our final drinks and dinner at the beach, before returning to our hotel for the evening.

dayInfo.title: Trip ends in Cartagena
dayInfo.description: : The trip ends after breakfast at our hotel in Cartagena. There are no activities planned today, so you are free to depart from Cartagena at any time. If your flight is departing later in the day, luggage storage facilities are available at our hotel. If you would like to receive a complimentary airport transfer today, you need to depart from Cartagena's Rafael Nunez International Airport (airport code: CTG), approximately a 20 minute drive from our hotel.

generalInfo:
This 12-day package offers you a real immersion into the Colombian hearth providing you an opportunity to learn and appreciate Colombian Coffee Culture.

Your journey starts in the capital city of Colombia; Bogotá. Where you will have a fully guided tour visiting the most important locations of La Candelaria (Bogotá’s oldest neighborhood). During your visit, you’ll be enjoying a few hours strolling through the Gold Museum, the largest collection of gold artifacts in the world, and have a perfect closure of the day by visiting the highest peak of the city “Monserrate”.

You will have the opportunity to visit 3 magic towns around Bogotá; Zipaquira where you’ll visit a Salt mine converted into a church, Raquira a typical small artisan town and Villa de Leyva a beautiful colonial town with cobblestone streets and 16th-century architecture where you will be overnighting.

Next, you’ll be flying to the heart of the coffee zone; Pereira, receiving you with a first adventure in one of the most picturesque locations you can visit while in Colombia “The Thermal Pools of Santa Rosa”. You'll take a trip into the lush Cocora Valley and receive a sensational coffee tour where you’ll discover the traditional methods of growing the perfect coffee bean. Before taking your flight to your next destination, you’ll be visiting one of the most colorful towns in Colombia; Filandia. Famous for its gastronomy, wonderful Colombian Culture architecture, and fabulous views.

In Medellin, you’ll receive a fully guided tour of the must-see places of the city along with Comuna 13, a completely transformed neighborhood full of graffiti and art. Next, you’ll be off to enjoy a fruit tasting of some of the most amazing tropical fruits at Plaza la America.

In Antioquia, besides Medellin, you’ll have the chance to stay in 2 colonial towns, for sure you’ll be overnighting in Guatape and choose between 2 heritage-listed towns; Jardin or Jerico.

NOTE
This is a completely tailor-made vacation which can be customized in any way to suit your requirements and budget. No fixed departure dates or minimum numbers. Can begin and end on any date to suit you.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at El Dorado International Airport in Bogota, your transport will be waiting at the airport to meet you and drive you straight to your hotel. The rest of the day is free for you to enjoy on your own. (Overnight in Bogotá)

You’ll be collected from your accommodation in Bogotá and taken on a guided excursion, where you’ll encounter the most important historical locations within La Candelaria, stroll through the Gold Museum, and visit the highest peak of the city "Monserrate" (Overnight in Bogotá)

You’ll be picked up from your hotel in Bogotá and be taken directly to the salt mine of Zipaquirá an ancient salt mine converted into an amazing church, before heading to your next stop, you'll wander the streets of Zipaquira. Next, travel to Ráquira, a small artisan town, and find everything here from hammocks to pottery all Colombian-made. Lastly, arrive in Villa de Leyva, a beautiful colonial town with cobblestone streets and 16th-century architecture. You will be escorted to your hotel, and then you are free to enjoy the evening dining at a nice restaurant. (Overnight Villa de Leyva)

Awake in this peaceful colonial city feeling like you're back in the 16th century. Following a delicious breakfast at your hotel, your guide will collect you to begin your tour of this unique location. You'll be visiting Monasterio Del Santo Eccehomo, Terracotta House, and the fossil museum. Following a wonderful lunch at one of the many fantastic restaurants, you'll travel back to the Capital city of Colombia! (Overnight Bogotá)

Enjoy a short flight to the heart of the coffee Zone; Pereira, where your transport will be waiting to take you to the wonderful hot springs of Santa Rosa. The Thermal Pools of Santa Rosa is truly one of the most picturesque locations you can visit while in Colombia. Set in a valley surrounded by tropical rainforest the hot springs are quite simply amazing. Following this relaxing experience, you'll carry on to your hotel in Salento. (Overnight in Salento)

This morning you'll start your day with some beautiful views from the Salento Mirador (Lookout), and a look down into the valley you will soon venture through. you'll take a trip into the lush Cocora Valley and a guided tour of the Wax Palm Forest. After you've stopped for a wonderful lunch you'll continue onto a sensational coffee tour. This is one of the best coffee tours in Colombia and so very unique.

After breakfast, you'll be taken to one of the most colorful towns in Colombia; Filandia. Famous for its gastronomy, wonderful Colombian Culture architecture, and fabulous views. Next, you'll be transferred to the airport for your short flight to Medellin. You'll be collected on arrival and taken directly to your hotel to check in and relax in your new settings. (Overnight in Medellin)

Your adventure in Medellin starts with a cable car ride over the hundreds of houses in Comuna 13. Next, you venture into the Comuna; a transformed neighborhood full of art graffiti, and colors. Next, you'll have a fruit tasting of some of the most amazing tropical fruits at Plaza la America. This place has almost every fruit you can imagine and so many we guarantee you’ve never seen before! Continuing your journey, you'll be visiting some highlights of the city such as Parques del río, barefoot park, Medellin city hall, Medellin Civic Center, Botero Plaza, and much more! Your tour will be finishing up around 3:30 pm, giving you the remainder of the day free to explore. (Overnight in Medellin)

Starting your tour at 8 am you begin your adventure with a stop is Old Peñol Replica Town in Guatape. This town square was constructed to look exactly like the sunken village of Old Peñol. You then venture to Guatape Rock also known as Piedra del Peñol, where you can climb the 740 steps to reach the top and have an amazing 360° view of the surrounding area. Next, you'll travel the short distance to Guatape town (The City of Zocalos) where you’ll walk the streets of this beautiful town. To complete your day you'll check-in to your hotel and enjoy the night in this wonderful lake side setting.(Overnight in Guatape)

Collected from your hotel around 7 am, you’ll relax in your private transport for a drive of around 3 hours to a Cocoa Finca close to the town of San Rafael. Once here you’ll be greeted with a wonderful breakfast of fresh fruit, eggs, Arepa (flat cornbread), and of course one of the freshest hot chocolates you’ll ever have in your life! Next, it’s off to explore this chocolate farm with an easy hike of around 1.5 hours through the cocoa plantation of a variety of different cocoa trees. Following, you will make your way back to the main house for a traditional lunch called a Fiambre. Next, it’s time to make some real chocolate yourself. Using a traditional artisan method. Your tour continues with a short walk to the Arenales river for a swim and an exfoliation with a mixture of fresh chocolate and the husk of the cocoa bean. To complete your tour, you’ll be transported back in your private vehicle to your hotel in Medellin. (Overnight in Medellin)
Your choice: Jardin OR Jerico. 2 heritage-listed towns near Medellin. Enjoy a full-day tour of the colonial towns of Antioquia, (Overnight in Medellin)
You'll be transferred to Medellin airport for your departure flight.

generalInfo:
Experience the best of Colombia's hidden treasures with a tailor-made 19-day itinerary that will take you on a remarkable journey of discovery. Starting in the vibrant capital city of Bogotá, you'll delve into its historical center, La Candelaria, where you'll explore the cobblestone streets, visit iconic landmarks like Monserrate for breathtaking views, and immerse yourself in the rich history of the Gold Museum.

From Bogotá, a short flight will transport you to La Macarena, the gateway to an extraordinary natural wonder: Caño Cristales, the five-color river. Spend four unforgettable days exploring this hidden gem, marveling at the vibrant colors of the river, discovering the enchanting Hiden Lake, and immersing yourself in the untouched beauty of the surrounding area.

Returning to Bogotá, your journey continues with visits to Zipaquira and Guatavita. In Zipaquira, venture deep into the underground Salt Cathedral, an awe-inspiring architectural marvel. In Guatavita, uncover the mysteries of the legendary El Dorado as you learn about the indigenous Muisca culture and visit the stunning Guatavita Lake.

Next, it's time to venture into the Amazon rainforest. Fly to Leticia, where you'll be welcomed into an eco-lodge nestled amidst the lush jungle. Prepare for an immersive experience as you embark on a night hike through the rainforest, discover the traditions of indigenous communities, learn about ancestral medicine, and immerse yourself in the vibrant cultural tapestry of the region.

Leaving the Amazon behind, your journey takes you to the vibrant city of Medellin. Explore the iconic Comuna 13 neighborhood, known for its transformation into a vibrant street art hub, and delve into the city's captivating history on a comprehensive city tour. Indulge your taste buds with a fruit-tasting experience, savoring the flavors of exotic tropical fruits.

A day trip to the picturesque town of Guatape awaits, where you'll climb the famous El Peñol rock for breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding lakes and islands.

Continuing your adventure, you'll take a flight to Nuqui, a hidden coastal paradise on Colombia's Pacific coast. Arriving by boat at your secluded eco-lodge, immerse yourself in the pristine jungle surroundings, unwind on secluded beaches, and have the extraordinary opportunity to witness majestic whales in their natural habitat.

After three unforgettable days in Nuqui, your journey concludes with a visit to an indigenous Embera community called Kiparate. Learn about their ancestral practices, traditional ways of life, and connect with the rich cultural heritage of these indigenous people.

This tailor-made itinerary is carefully designed to uncover the secret parts of Colombia, immersing you in its natural wonders, rich history, vibrant culture, and enchanting indigenous communities. Get ready for a truly transformative journey that will leave you with lifelong memories and a deep appreciation for the hidden gems of Colombia.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at any time to be collected from the airport and taken to your accommodation. Depending on your arrival time we can provide you with another tour or with suggestions of places to see and where to go. Your driver will be waiting for you outside of the terminal holding a sign with your name. Be sure to drink plenty of water to help you adapt to the altitude. (Overnight Bogotá)

You'll be picked up from your accommodation in Bogotá and taken on a guided excursion through La Candelaria. Explore historical landmarks like Bolivar Plaza, Casa Nariño, and more. Immerse yourself in the fascinating exhibits of El Museo del Oro, showcasing ancient indigenous artifacts. Experience the awe-inspiring views and cultural richness as you ascend Monserrate. It's a journey that will leave you captivated by Bogotá's history and natural beauty. (Overnight Bogotá)

Embark on a 3-day adventure to Caño Cristales, the stunning River of Five Colors. After a briefing in La Macarena, drop off your bags and savor a local lunch. Depending on availability, visit Cristalitos & El Mirador or El Bajo Lozada on the first day. Hike to Caño Cristalitos for breathtaking views of the savannah and enjoy a swim. Return to La Macarena for dinner and rest, preparing for tomorrow's adventure. (Overnight in La Macarena)

After breakfast, you'll hop on a boat for a 20-minute ride along the Rio Guayabero. From there, you'll switch to a 4x4 vehicle for about 40 minutes before embarking on a one-hour hike to the magnificent Caño Cristales, the River of Seven Colors. Once we arrive, you'll have the opportunity to explore the area, finding the perfect spots for stunning photos and taking refreshing swims in the crystal-clear lagoons. After a delicious typical lunch and moments of peaceful reflection, you'll retrace your steps, combining hiking, boating, and 4x4 transportation. (Overnight La Macarena)

Your guide will take you on a short boat ride and a 40-minute horseback ride through farmland and small creeks. Reach a small Finca and continue on foot through the Amazon jungle, boarding a rowboat in the Lagoon of Silence. Discover unique palm trees and wildlife while paddling for 20 minutes. Enjoy lunch, relaxation, and traditional games at a finca. Hike through more jungle, swim in the river, and witness monkeys feeding. Return on horseback and boat, cherishing unforgettable memories. (Overnight La Macarena)

Witness a breathtaking sunrise over the vast plains of Los Llanos from El Mirador hotel. Enjoy breakfast before exploring Caño Piedras, a paradise for bird lovers. Plant a tree and capture photos of colorful Macaws and parrots. Take a short hike to natural pools for a refreshing swim. Bid farewell to this wonderful destination and catch your lunchtime flight back to Bogotá, completing another amazing adventure. (Overnight Bogotá)

Embark on a captivating journey from Bogotá. Descend into the Zipaquirá Salt Mine Cathedral, explore the historic town of Zipaquirá, and marvel at Lake Guatavita's beauty. Discover centuries of history and legends in this enchanting Colombian adventure. (Overnight Bogotá)

You'll catch a flight from Bogotá to Leticia. You'll be collected from the airport and be taken on a short drive through Leticia to the wharf, where you'll catch a boat up the Amazon River to your Amazon Jungle Ecolodge for the next 3 nights. You'll be arriving in the mid-afternoon after a boat ride of approximately 2 hours, and in time for a bit of relaxation before dinner. Following dinner when it is nice and dark you'll venture out on a night safari into the jungle, In search of tarantulas, giant insects, mammals, and different Amazonian fauna and flora. (Overnight Eco-lodge Amazon)

Indulge in a hearty breakfast before embarking on a short trip up the Amazon River to the vibrant "Painted Village" of Mocagua community. Marvel at the Murals of Mocagua, a project promoting art, culture, and environmental conservation. After a delicious lunch at the eco-lodge, hike through the lush Calanoa Reserve to Matamata creek, surrounded by dense jungle. If water levels permit, paddle down the Amazon River, immersing yourself in the captivating canopy. Return to the eco-lodge for another boat ride to Mocagua Island, exploring its unique flora, fauna, and enchanting interior lakes. End your day on the dock, fishing for Piranhas and savoring the serene surroundings. (Overnight Eco-lodge Amazon)

You'll enjoy a good breakfast followed by another boat cruise. This time visit the Milciades Gardens, where you'll meet a Cocama medicine man (Shaman). You'll walk through the lush vegetation of this garden, guided by this wise man, with a vast knowledge of both the traditional way of cultivating the forest and the many healing powers of plants within. You'll learn which plants can be used to cure many illnesses and secrets passed down for generations. Following another fabulous and fresh lunch, you'll take the boat across to the other side of the Amazon River and into the territory of Peru. From here you'll enjoy a wonderful and peaceful time spotting camera-shy pink and grey dolphins, that are unique to the Amazon region. You'll stay out on the waters to enjoy a beautiful explosion of color on the river as the sun begins to go down. In the evening you'll receive a home visit from a local Shaman and build a deep connection with your jungle surroundings. This traditional medicine healer will perform a smoke bath blessing with incense made with Amazonian resins. The traditional doctor sings and blesses travelers in this personal ritual. (Overnight Eco-lodge Amazon)

Rising before most birds have left their nests, (and before you've had any breakfast) you'll be out and about at 6 am for some amazing Bird Watching. Walking a short distance from the eco-lodge you'll enjoy the morning rituals of many of our feathered friends in the skies and in the trees. On return to the eco-lodge, you'll enjoy another fresh breakfast before your next adventure. You'll catch a flight to Medellin, and be taken to your new hotel. (Overnight Medellin).

Immerse yourself in the contrasting sides of Medellin on a captivating city tour. Begin with a cable car ride over Comuna 13, once plagued by violence but now known for its street art and innovative electric escalators. Explore Parques del Río, a scenic area bridging East and West Medellin, featuring unique sculptures and tranquil spaces. Experience Barefoot Park, where your senses will come alive through water sounds, bamboo paths, and sensory pools. Visit the Medellin Civic Center, home to important administrative buildings, monuments, and the impressive vertical garden. Discover Botero Plaza, showcasing 23 sculptures by renowned artist Fernando Botero. Marvel at the Cultural Palace and the historic churches of Candelaria and Veracruz. Finally, explore the Parque Memorial Inflexion, a memorial park dedicated to the victims of narcoterrorism, with sections honoring heroes and recalling past bombings and attacks. (Overnight Medellin)

Embark on a scenic drive to Guatape Rock, where you'll climb 740 steps for breathtaking views. Explore Guatape town, known for its vibrant Zocalo tradition and charming streets. Visit the main square, Remembrance Street, the boardwalk, and the church. Enjoy the beauty of Lake Guatape and take a tuk-tuk ride for a memorable experience. (Overnight Medellin)

On arrival at Nuquí, you'll be collected from the airport and taken directly to the marina for your boat rides to your home for the next 3 nights; La Bayka eco-lodge. Set in a fantastic scene just a short stroll to the water's edge, this is an idyllic location to escape city life's hustle and bustle. You'll be arriving late morning and have time to organize your things before enjoying a wonderful fresh lunch. Following lunch, you'll be going out in search of some of the many humpback whales that visit every year between the months of May and November (best months are July to October). Following this wonderful experience (Please remember that occasionally whales may only be seen at a distance) you'll return to the eco-lodge to relax and enjoy this beautiful setting. On your return to dry land, you can enjoy an easy 30 min walk to the Cascada del Amor (The waterfall of Love) where you can enjoy a refreshing swim in this peaceful location. (Overnight Eco-lodge Pacific)

You'll wake to the wonderful relaxing sounds of the ocean and the native birds singing at the start of another beautiful Pacific Coast day! After breakfast, you'll be off in search of some of those amazingly wonderful humpback whales and their baby that will be swimming nearby. You'll be enjoying 2-3 hours out on the ocean before heading back to the eco-lodge for some me-time followed by another fresh lunch. Following lunch, you'll be walking along the beach for approximately an hour until you come to some wonderful thermal hot springs ($15,000 peso entrance fee not included). Once here you'll soak in the pools and relax in this amazing dream-like setting. You'll then venture back to the eco-lodge in time for a beautiful sunset and another wonderful dinner. (Overnight Eco-lodge Pacific)

Experience the Kipara Te ethno-village, immersing yourself in an indigenous community for 2 nights. Enjoy a warm welcome, traditional drink, and delicious local lunch upon arrival. Take a guided tour of the community, visit the Lumero waterfall, and enjoy traditional dances or a night walk. Sleep in a magical lodging surrounded by nature's soothing sounds. (Indigenous community)

After waking up in the middle of the Chocoan jungle, you will enjoy a delicious breakfast served by the community. You will be ready for the walk to the sacred path "Ejua Sapopoabu" . During the approximately two-hour tour you will be able to spot birds, frogs and other species. You will also be able to identify some endemic trees of the region. You will learn to recognize some sounds of wildlife. Upon reaching the trail you will participate in a beautiful ritual of commitment to "mother nature" , then you will return to the community to enjoy a fantastic lunch. In the afternoon there is an optional activity of artisanal fishing. Already at night the sacred tambo awaits you to rest peacefully, after this connection with what surrounds you.

Early in the morning your delicious breakfast will be waiting for you. Then a sacred painting session with the community will be the farewell ceremony. You will have the opportunity to buy some handcrafts made by the indigenous people and then your boat will be ready to take you back to Nuquí to catch your flight back to Medellin. (Overnight Medellin)
Hablamos pronto, safe travels home, and visit again soon! We’ll have transport waiting to take you to the airport at your desired time.

generalInfo:
Embark on a Magical Journey Through Colombia

Get ready to plunge into the vibrant heart of Colombia, a land where every corner tells a story and every experience leaves a lasting impression. This meticulously designed journey invites you to explore a nation where bustling cities meet wild jungles, sun-kissed beaches, and traditions that span centuries. We've woven together the very best of Colombia's rich culture, stunning natural beauty, and a deep commitment to sustainable travel, ensuring an unforgettable adventure that's as impactful as it is inspiring.

Begin your exploration in Bogotá, Colombia's lively capital. Wander through La Candelaria, a historic district brimming with colorful colonial buildings, vibrant street art, and hidden cafes where the city’s rhythm comes alive. Visit Plaza de Bolívar, surrounded by iconic landmarks, and gaze upon the sanctuary of Monserrate, offering breathtaking views of the Sabana de Bogotá plateau.

Venture into the heart of the Amazon with a Tuk-Tuk tour through Leticia and Tabatinga. Witness the grandeur of the Amazon River, explore Orellana Park, and stroll through bustling markets offering medicinal plants and local crafts. At Santander Park, marvel at the sight of thousands of parrots returning home at sunset. Continue with a night walk in the Marashá Natural Reserve, where the symphony of the jungle and the glow of nocturnal creatures create an unforgettable experience.

In the Pacific Coast, prepare for a magical encounter with humpback whales. Paddle alongside these gentle giants or join a boat tour to watch mothers and calves play in the warm waters. This seasonal spectacle is a profound reminder of the wonders of marine life and nature’s rhythm.


This journey is not just a tour; it’s an invitation to connect deeply with Colombia’s vibrant spirit, its natural wonders, and its sustainable future. Every step you take supports local communities and eco-tourism initiatives, making your adventure meaningful and impactful.

Join us and let Colombia captivate your heart. Book your adventure today and experience the magic for yourself!

dayInfo.description: Bogota Transfer from Bogotá Airport to your hotel Car Transfer. Estimated travel time: Between 15 minutes and 1 hour depending on hotel location

Bogota Half-day walking tour of Bogotá Get ready for a half-day walking tour of Bogota, where you will get to see a handful of the top sites. Become acquainted with the historic, cobbled epicentre of La Candelaria - a blur of multi-coloured colonial buildings, housing trendy cafes and bars, with live music pouring out onto the streets, you get an insight into the wonderful Colombian culture. And soaring above it all, seen from across the whole Sabana de Bogotá (the plateau Bogotá is situated), is the white-washed walls of the sanctuary of Christ Fallen, glinting atop the vertiginous Monserrate mountain. After wandering around the city's historic centre, explore the central Plaza de Bolivar, ringed with four of Bogotá's architectural highlights: the city hall, the houses of congress, the supreme court, and the venerable Catedral Primada. The charming sight gives you a taste of the pre-Columbian era. Lastly you will get to explore the Museo Botero, which houses one of Latin America's most important international art collections. Among the impressive artwork, you can discover the paintings and sculptures of Colombia's most renowned artists Francisco Botero. Ascend Cerro de Monserrate Excursion: You will climb Cerro de Monserrate, the Andean peak that towers over Bogotá, its slopes beginning at the edge of La Candelaria district and ascending to 3152 metres above sea level. Atop the hill (cerro) is the Sanctuary of Saint Christ Fallen, a major pilgrimage destination due to the various miracles that have been attributed to its altar statue. Today you can either climb along the one hour walking path up to the peak, ride the funicular Monserrate train, or take the seven minute cable-car straight to the top. When you reach the summit, enjoy the panoramic views across the green Bogotá Sabana below - the ultimate way to do a Bogotá city tour! Downtown and south Bogotá are also easily visible looking west, so wait until evening and watch the sunset wash over the town’s dwarfed buildings.

Leticia Domestic flight from Bogotá to Leticia Estimated flight time: 2 hours Transfer from Leticia to Marashá Natural Reserve (boat and hike) Boat Transfer: Upon arrival to Leticia, transfer by boat (approx. 45 min) and then hike for (approx. 1 hour) until reaching the Marashá Natural Reserve located in Peru for your check-in. During the transfer will be possible to admire the beautiful centenary trees: Ceiba, Capinuri, Chuchuaza. Night walk in Marashá Natural Reserve Excursion: In the night, go walking accompanied by a local guide, who will show you the different characteristics of the place and carefully where you would have the chance to observe the different species of fauna and flora.

Leticia Zipline at Marashá Natural Reserve Excursion: Enjoy a 250-metre canopy (zip-line) route. First, climb a tree to reach a 38 metre high platform, where you can enjoy a unique view of the lake and of the jungle before travelling to the next platform. Afternoon activities at Marashá Natural Reserve Excursion: After lunch, you will see Victoria Regia a giant Amazon Lotus, here monkeys, different kinds of birds while bird watching and piranha fishing. After the tour we go back to the lodge of a delicious dinner. Night alligator safari in Marashá Natural Reserve Excursion: Later, go on a night alligator safari and enjoy of the wildlife living at the reserve.

Leticia Transfer from Marashá to Calanoa Boat Transfer: We will go to the Calanoa Jungle Lodge in boat. Arrival and check in at the lodge. Estimated travel time - 1 hour. Visit Mocagua community and the Miqueando project Excursion: Visit Mocagua community and the Miqueando project where it is possible to observe and learn about these primates and birdwatching (you may watch the Piura), supporting the Sarah Beneth’s Foundation, which works with the indigenous community of Mocagua. We will have lunch in the village. Jungle Walk and Boat Ride Excursion: Explore the lush jungle ecosystem around Leticia and return to the main town via boat. Enjoy a traditional boat ride down Matamata Creek (approx 30 minutes) and immerse yourself in the incredible scenery.

Leticia Tarapoto Lake and San Francisco excursion at Calanoa Excursion: After lunch we will continue by boat for a wildlife-watching excursion on Tarapoto Lake. You'll spot pink dolphins and exotic birds, and will have the opportunity to try your hand at traditional fishing. On the way back, visit San Francisco where a local indigenous family works to protect the caimans. Dinner and rest at the lodge. Puerto Narino tour at Calanoa Excursion: After breakfast, go on a native boat to the village Puerto Narino, a town on the shore of the Amazon River, where you'll have time for a walk and can enjoy a typical lunch

Leticia - Medellin Transfer from Calanoa to Leticia Boat Transfer: After breakfast, transfer by boat down the amazon river towards Leticia. Estimated travel time: 2 hours Tour of Tabatinga and Leticia Excursion: Go on a Tuk-Tuk Tour and visit the town Leticia in Colombia and Tabatinga in Brazil. You will be able to admire the magnificent Amazon River, the Orellana Park, the traditional market where it is possible to find typical medicinal plants, and Santander Park where thousands of parrots live. We have lunch in Leticia and you will have some free time to do some craft shopping. Domestic flight from Leticia to Bogotá Scheduled flight Transfer: Fly North to the capital of Colombia, Bogotá. Estimated flight time: 2 hours Domestic flight from Bogotá to Medellín Scheduled flight Transfer: You will catch a domestic flight from Bogotá (BOG) to Medellín (MDE). Estimated travel time: 1 hour.

Nuquí Domestic flight from Medellin to Nuqui Scheduled flight Transfer: Transfer to Medellin airport in preparation for your domestic flight. Head east to the charming Colombian coast ready for the next part of your adventure! Flight time: Approx 50 minutes Whale Watching Tour Excursion: This tour is offered on a boat or on a stand-up paddle board. It's a great way to get to know Colombia's marine wildlife and especially its whale population! Humpback whales come to the Colombian pacific to give birth to their calves and remain here until October, when they are old enough to migrate with their mothers. Enjoy the spectacle of the calves at play and get up close to these incredible animals.

Nuquí Rio Terco Hike Excursion: Spend time exploring the incredible landscape around Nuqui, and enjoy the Rio Terco waterfalls! Along the way your local guide will explain how the local communities use some plants and trees for medicinal purposes. Admire the variety of fauna found such as toucans, crabs, spiders, howling monkeys, butterflies among others. Have a short bath in the waterfall before going back to the hotel. Whale Watching Tour Shared Excursion: This tour is offered on a boat or on a stand-up paddle board. It's a great way to get to know Colombia's marine wildlife and especially its whale population! Humpback whales come to the Colombian pacific to give birth to their calves and remain here until October, when they are old enough to migrate with their mothers. Enjoy the spectacle of the calves at play and get up close to these incredible animals. This is an optional Whale Watching tour if you had no luck spotting them yesterday - or if you want to go again!

Domestic flight from Nuqui to Medellin Scheduled flight Transfer: Fly west back to Medellin as part of your return journey to Bogota. Flight time: Approx 50 minutes Domestic flight from Medellín to Bogotá Scheduled flight Transfer: You will catch a domestic flight from Medellín (MDE) to Bogotá (BOG). Estimated travel time: 1 hour.

tourName: Columbia express, 8 day tailor made holiday
generalInfo: You’ll walk through a Caribbean jungle discovering hidden beaches and wildlife along the way; Enjoy a  tour of Minca, a coffee Finca, a cocoa farm, and a refreshing swim under a hidden waterfall in the mountains of the Sierra Nevada; Enjoy a day on the Rosario Islands, explore Cartagena by night, and have options to visit an indigenous village, rejuvenate your body in a Volcanic mud bath, cruise through mangroves in a canoe, and still have some free time to explore other hidden gems.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Santa Marta Airport, your transport will be waiting at the airport to meet you and drive you straight to your hotel in the historic center of Santa Marta. . Get settled and enjoy the rest of the day on your own.

Travel to the small town of Minca where you'll breathe in the fresh mountain air and enjoy a tour of this wonderful little mountain pueblo, including its wonderful cafes and artisan shops. You'll enjoy an authentic coffee tour, uncover the process of creating delicious chocolate and explore some hidden waterfalls.

Cabo San Juan - You’ll be taken to Tayrona Park and enjoy a 2-hour ecological walk through the jungle and visit 4 beaches along the way learning about the local environment and the local indigenous. Relax and enjoy some fantastic beach time in this magic place. (Optional: Stay 2 nights in a hotel in or near Tayrona Park)
Free day - We can organize optional activities such as a visit to an archelogy site in the jungle of Sierra Nevada OR a hidden beach named "Playa Cristal" (Crystal Beach)

Relax in a morning drive along the coast to your waiting hotel in Cartagena. At 4 pm you start a city tour in the Jewel of Colombia, the magical UNESCO heritage-listed city of Cartagena de Indias Colombia. Including the must-see stops, plazas, restaurants, cafes, and bars within the walled city, along with one of the oldest and most bohemian neighborhoods in Cartagena; Getsemani.

Free day - We can organize optional activities such as a visit to an Afro-Colombian community and beautiful mangroves, a sunset catamaran cruise, a trip to the mud volcano, or a rum and chocolate tasting.

Enjoy a wonderful ocean cruise on a speedboat to the Rosario Islands; arriving at a beautiful picturesque beach for a typical Caribbean lunch, crystal clear waters, water sports, white sands, and palm trees. You'll be assigned your personal beach space which will be exclusive for yourself and members of your group.
Airport transfer for departure

generalInfo:
Welcome to an epic 23-day journey that will take you on an unforgettable adventure across Colombia! Starting in the bustling capital city of Bogota, you'll have the opportunity to explore some of its most iconic landmarks, including the world-renowned Gold Museum, the charming colonial neighborhood of La Candelaria, and the stunning Monserrate mountain.

The next day, get ready for a flight to Leticia, where you'll be whisked away to the remote Calanoa Ecolodge deep in the Amazon rainforest. You'll experience the magic of the jungle as you embark on a thrilling night safari, followed by a visit to the Mocagua community and a trip to the enchanting Milciades Garden. On the final day in Leticia, wake up early for a mesmerizing bird-watching experience before catching your flight back to Bogota.

After a short stop in Zipaquira and Raquira, you'll be transferred to the picturesque colonial town of Villa de Leyva. Take a full-day tour of the town's charming streets, stunning architecture, and fascinating history. The next day, head to Barichara for an exhilarating Guane hike and a delicious food tour that will introduce you to the best of Colombian cuisine.

After your time in Barichara, you'll make your way to Bucaramanga via the National Park Chicamocha. The next day, explore the vibrant city of Medellin and its famous Comuna 13, known for its street art and cultural diversity. Then, enjoy a scenic drive to the stunning Guatape region, where you'll be treated to stunning vistas and traditional Colombian hospitality.

Get ready for a change of pace as you take a flight to Colombia's Pacific Coast, where you'll spend four glorious days relaxing, whale watching, and exploring the lush jungle and sandy beaches. Then, head to the coffee zone to learn about the country's famous coffee and cocoa production. Explore the breathtaking Cocora Valley and take a coffee and cocoa tour in Viterbo before taking a flight to Cartagena.

In Cartagena, get ready to be dazzled by the colorful colonial architecture and rich history of this charming coastal town. Take a city tour, enjoy a sunset catamaran cruise, and visit the bustling Bazurto market. Finally, take a day trip to the beautiful Rosario Islands, where you can snorkel, sunbathe, and soak up the Caribbean vibes.

This epic journey through Colombia is packed with adventure, cultural experiences, and natural beauty, offering you an unparalleled insight into this diverse and captivating country. Come and discover the magic of Colombia for yourself!

dayInfo.description: Arrive at any time to be collected from the airport and taken to your accommodation. Depending on your arrival time we can provide you with another tour or with suggestions of places to see and where to go. Be sure to drink plenty of water to help you adapt to the altitude. (Overnight Bogotá)

Explore Bogotá's historic La Candelaria district on a guided tour, visiting key sites like Bolivar Plaza, the Presidential Palace, and the Gold Museum. Then, ascend Monserrate mountain to learn about its significance to the Musica people, browse artisan markets, and take in panoramic views of the city. (Overnight Bogotá)

Relax and enjoy your flight over national parks into the heart of the Amazon. You'll be arriving at Leticia around 12 pm, and your transport will be waiting. You'll be catching a boat ride of approximately 2 hours, and in time for a bit of relaxation before dinner. Following dinner when it is nice and dark you'll venture out on a night safari into the jungle, In search of tarantulas, giant insects, mammals, and different Amazonian fauna and flora. (Overnight in Calanoa)

You'll enjoy a good breakfast followed by a short trip up the Amazon River to discover the "Painted Village" of a Mocagua community. Here you'll enjoy hiking through this unique environment and discovering very different flora and fauna. To finish your day you'll enjoy some time sitting on the dock back at the Eco-lodge, and trying your hand at a spot of fishing for some of the mighty Piranhas!

Today you'll be visiting the Milciades Gardens, where you'll meet a Cocama medicine man (Shaman). You'll walk through the lush vegetation of this garden, guided by this wise man, with a vast knowledge of both the traditional way of cultivating the forest and the many healing powers of plants within. Following lunch, you'll take the boat across to the other side of the Amazon River and into the territory of Peru. From here you'll enjoy a wonderful and peaceful time spotting camera-shy pink and grey dolphins, that are unique to the Amazon region.

Rising before most birds have left their nests, (and before you've had any breakfast) you'll be out and about at 6 am for some amazing Bird Watching. Walking a short distance from the eco-lodge you'll enjoy the morning rituals of many of our feathered friends in the skies and in the trees. On return to the eco-lodge, you'll enjoy another fresh breakfast before the next part of your Colombian adventure (Overnight Bogotá)

You’ll be picked up from your hotel in Bogotá and be taken directly to the salt mine of Zipaquirá, where you’ll uncover the ingenuity of the people who 590 ft (180 m) underground converted this ancient salt mine into the amazing church that receives as many as 3000 people every Sunday of the year. Next, travel onto Ráquira, a small artisan town and a dream location for anyone wishing to do a bit of shopping. You'll find everything here from hammocks to pottery and all Colombian-made Lastly, arrive in Villa de Leyva, a beautiful colonial town with cobblestone streets and 16th-century architecture. You will be escorted to your hotel, and then you are free to enjoy the evening dining at a nice restaurant. (Overnight Villa de Leyva)

Following a delicious breakfast at your hotel, your guide will collect you to begin your tour of this unique location. Starting with a 2-hour stroll around the beautiful cobblestone streets leading to the largest plaza in Colombia and visiting the Monasterio Del Santo Eccehomo - Declared part of Colombia’s architectural heritage in 1998, the initial convent was founded in 1620. Following a stop for lunch at one of the many fantastic restaurants, you'll explore 2 more sites; The Terracotta House and The Fossil Museum. After your tour, you'll be transferred to Barichara, with a historical stop in El Socorro. (Overnight Barichara)

Hiking from Barichara to Guane is one of the must-do hikes during your stay in Santander, Colombia. And the only way to make this an even more fantastic experience is to finish up with a wonderful 3-hour gastronomical tour through Barichara! During your tour you’ll walk through a mixture of both a tropical and humid dry forest, learning the history of the Guane indigenous people, the colonization process, the geological processes that have taken place in the area, along with the discoveries of many fossils. Following this wonderful tour, you’ll be enjoying a 40 min Tuk-Tuk ride back to Barichara to arrive in time to start your food tour of Barichara. You’ll enjoy the sampling of a number of dishes that are genuinely distinctive to this region of Santander, Colombia. Visiting several representative restaurants where you will try a variety of different products of the local autochthonous gastronomy. (Overnight Barichara)

Enjoy a scenic transfer from Barichara to Bucaramanga with a visit to the Chicamocha National Park and a ride on the longest cable car in Colombia. Explore the Guane Museum and the Comuneros Movement monument before taking a 30-minute cable car ride with stunning views of the Chicamocha Canyon. In Bucaramanga, you'll be catching a flight to Medellin. (Overnight Medellin)

Take a cable car ride over the Comuna 13 neighborhood, home to many displaced people due to Colombia's internal conflict. Visit Parques del Río, Barefoot Park, and the Medellin Civic Center to see monuments, gardens, and sculptures. See Botero's sculptures in San Antonio and at Botero Plaza. Visit the Cultural Palace and the colonial-period churches of Candelaria and Veracruz. End the tour at the Parque Memorial Inflexion, a memorial park dedicated to victims of narcoterrorism. (Overnight Medellin)

Drive to Guatape Rock with a stop at a replica of Old Peñol's town plaza, sunk at the bottom of Lake Guatape. Climb the 740 steps to the top of La Piedra for amazing views. Visit Guatape town, known as "The City of Zocalos," to learn about the tradition and see the Plaza, Remembrance Street, boardwalk, and church. Enjoy a tuk-tuk ride and more before heading back to Medellín. (Overnight Medellin)

Enjoy a short flight to Nuquí arriving around mid-morning. Upon arrival at Nuquí, you'll be greeted at the airport and whisked away to the marina for a scenic boat ride to your home for the next three nights - La Bayka eco-lodge. Nestled in a stunning location, just a short walk from the water's edge, La Bayka is the perfect place to unwind and escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life. After settling in, you'll be treated to a delicious fresh lunch. In addition to enjoying the natural beauty of the surrounding area, your stay also includes a guided 30-minute walk to Cascada del Amor, where you can take a refreshing swim, a one-hour guided walk to the Thermal Hot Springs (entrance fee not included), and a 2-3 hour whale watching tour (available from July to mid-October). Please note, there is a tourist tax of $30,000 Colombian Pesos per person that needs to be paid before leaving the airport.
You'll wake to the wonderful relaxing sounds of the ocean and the native birds singing at the start of another beautiful Pacific Coast day!

You'll wake to the wonderful relaxing sounds of the ocean and the native birds singing at the start of another beautiful Pacific Coast day! Optional Activities: Subject to minimum quotas of people and are chosen, booked, and paid for in the hotel. Whale Watching (2-3hrs) from $190,000 pesos per person: Tour a 4 Encantos (4-8hrs) from $50,000 pesos per person: Hiking el Río Joví (4-6 hrs) from $50,000 pesos per person (min 2pax): Tour to Cabo Corrientes (3-5 hrs) from $200,000 pesos per person (min 4pax): Cooking lessons (2-4 hrs) from $70,000 pesos per person (min 2pax): Kayak hire from $30,000 pesos per hour: Hire the 2 person kayak for 1 hour or more to explore the bays and beaches up and down this beautiful coast of Colombia.

You'll be waking once again to the soothing sounds of the waves and the singing birds searching for their morning meal. You'll have time for a quick swim or a short hike, and another wonderful breakfast before taking a boat back to Nuquí and on to the airport for your flight back to Medellín. On arrival, you'll be collected and taken directly to your hotel to check-in and relax in the city of the eternal spring. (Overnight Medellin)
Enjoy a short flight to Pereira. Free Afternoon or Optional Tour Santa Rosa Thermal Pools (Overnight Salento)

Following breakfast, you'll take a trip into the lush Cocora Valley and a guided tour of the Wax Palm Forest. This valley is spectacular by itself, but when combined with the forest filled with the tallest wax palms in the world, it becomes an almost spiritual experience. You'll spend a few hours walking through this peaceful zone with more beautiful views in every direction. Continuing today's journey you'll travel to one of the most colorful towns in Colombia; Filandia. Famous for its gastronomy, wonderful Colombian Culture architecture, and fabulous views, you'll enjoy a stop for lunch at one of the many wonderful restaurants and a walking tour where you'll be able to take many photos of the beautiful buildings, along with a trip to the mirador (lookout) where you'll be amazed at the spectacular 360' views you receive. (Overnight Salento)

Visit Viterbo Caldas for a unique tour of cacao and coffee plantations. Walk through lush plantations, bamboo forests, and discover exotic fruits. Learn about the production process of cacao and coffee while crossing a hand-made bridge. Visit a 120-year-old house made of Bahareque and roast the beans on a 100-year-old stovetop. Experience the artisanal methods by making and enjoying some of the freshest and richest coffee and chocolate of your life. You'll be transferred to the Airport of Pereira, for your afternoon flight to Cartagena. (Overnight Cartagena)

Our bilingual guide explains the history behind every important site you visit. You'll discover panoramic views of the city from Cerro de La Popa; a convent built in 1606, and the highest peak overlooking Cartagena. Explore inside the historic Castle San Felipe, learning the paths and methods of defending this heritage-listed structure from pirates and invaders around the world. Enjoy an in-depth private tour of the Jewel of Colombia, the magical UNESCO heritage-listed city of Cartagena de Indias Colombia. Including the must-see stops, plazas, restaurants, cafes, and bars within the walled city. For the afternoon you will enjoy a catamaran sunset cruise (Overnight in Cartagena)

Explore the colorful neighborhood with a bilingual guide, seeing graffiti-filled streets, Centenario Park, and Holy Trinity Square, plus hidden cafes, bars, and restaurants. Then, visit the typical Colombian markets of Bazurto with a guided tour of the stalls, sampling exotic fruits, fresh meats, and fish. Discover how locals cook their meals and enjoy a fresh lunch at the authentic restaurant called Celia’s. End the tour with a freshly made juice of your choice. (Overnight Cartagena)

Enjoy a wonderful ocean cruise on a speedboat to the Rosario Islands; arriving at a beautiful picturesque beach for a typical Caribbean lunch, crystal clear waters, water-sports, white sands, and palm trees. You'll be assigned your personal beach space which will be exclusive for yourself and members of your group. (Overnight Cartagena)
We’ll have transport waiting to take you to the airport at your desired time.

generalInfo:
Begin high in the Andes, where snow-dusted volcanoes and crater lakes frame your first hikes in Ecuador. Walk the rim of the turquoise Quilotoa caldera, trace petrified lava trails to the Pita Waterfall, and breathe in the crisp Cotopaxi air.

Then swap altitude for islands, boarding a yacht to cruise the otherworldly Galápagos. Wildlife here is endemic and often either curious about, or oblivious to, visitors. Step around giant iguanas lying across your path, walk among waist-height tortoises, observe sea lions sunning themselves on volcanic beaches. Cross lava fields, snorkel with turtles, see flamingo-filled lagoons and hike around crater-edges. Your floating home is small, stylish and sustainably run.
