Next: Colombia for an urban change of scene. Touch down in Medellín and uncover a city transformed – graffiti-splashed Comuna 13, breakdancing kids and sun-dappled sculpture parks. Then it’s off to the coffee country for charming, colourful country towns and a hit of slow travel: drifting downstream on a bamboo raft, hiking beneath the world’s tallest palms, and sipping rich, freshly ground coffee in Filandia’s cafés.

Step into the jungle in La Macarena National Park. Hike to wild waterfalls in the Sierra de la Macarena, and bathe in the rainbow river of Caño Cristales where water is red and the pools glow pink. Then finish in style in Cartagena – all cobbled streets, bougainvillea-strewn balconies and sultry nights. Take a salsa class. Explore the fortress. Sail to secret snorkelling spots in the Rosario Islands.

This is Latin America at its most generous – wild and wondrous. You’ll walk, raft, hike and swim your way through it, with private guides, charming local stays and stories to tell for years to come.

Our sabbaticals and experiential holidays are entirely customisable to you - use this itinerary as an inspirational springboard and get in touch to make this trip your own. All transfers and most excursions are private.

dayInfo.description: WELCOME TO ECUADOR: Upon arrival in Quito airport, you will be welcomed by your guide, who will accompany you on a private transfer to your hotel, a 15-minute drive away. Take it slowly on Day 1 to acclimatise to the altitude.

COTOPAXI VOLCANO HIKE: Your guide will pick you up from your hotel and you will be driven to Cotopaxi National Park for a day of hiking in rugged landscapes. Weather permitting, you will be able to see the snowcapped summit of Cotopaxi volcano. Stop at the Interpretation Center, where you can learn about the history of this spectacular volcano’s major eruptions, as well as the local flora and fauna. Continue to Lake Limpiopungo to explore the surrounding area on foot. Lunch is included at a local lodge. A 2-hour afternoon hike with your guide will take you to Mt. Cotopaxi’s Jose F. Rivas refuge (4,800 m) where you will be able to enjoy spectacular views of the volcano and the surrounding Andean peaks. After, transfer to your Lodge, located just 6kms from Cototpaxi National Park and surrounded by the rugged peaks of four towering mountains.

PITA WATERFALL HIKE: Enjoy a guided hike to Pita River Waterfall. Its source is the pristine glacial melt water of Mt. Cotopaxi. During the trail, explore the flora and fauna of the high Andean montane forest, walk along trails with petrified lava, visit viewpoints and admire a beautiful landscape.

QUILOTOA CRATER LAKE & TIGUA COMMUNITY: Head south today on a 3-hour drive with your guide to Quilotoa volcano crater. Hike around the crater's rim, admiring the mysteriously green lake within. On your return, stop at the community of Tigua. Visit one of the first and best painters in Tigua, Julio. Grab a paintbrush and create your own mountain scene on stone under his gentle guidance.

ROSES AND HACIENDA LUNCH - TRANSFER TO QUITO: You will be picked up from your lodge for your private transfer to Quito. Stop en-route at a beautiful rose farm. Roses are a huge export of Ecuador and you’ll see many varieties as you explore the hacienda and learn about this industry. Many products created by this beautiful flower are also available to enjoy and taste, such as rose honey, vinegar, chocolate and jam. Enjoy lunch at a traditional hacienda.

FLY TO GALAPAGOS FOR 8-DAY CRUISE: The Galapagos Islands are a volcanic archipelago, of which only a handful of islands are inhabited. The rest remain wild, home to hundreds of endemic species which seem completely fearless. On arrival at Baltra Island, you will be transferred to the yacht, where you will embark on your cruise with the other passengers (up to 16 in total including you). Your cabin features panoramic windows, private bathroom, hot water, and air-conditioning, and there is WiFi onboard. BACHAS BEACH EXCURSION: Swim at Bachas beach in the afternoon. Wildlife frequently seen in this area include flamingos, technicoloured Sally Lightfoot crabs, hermit crabs, black-necked stilts, and long-beaked whimbrels. Sea turtles also nest on the beach.

CRUISE DAY 2 - Situated on Santa Cruz Island, Dragon Hill is one the lengthier Galapagos walking trails. Follow the trail along a beach and up to the lagoon lookout to spot bright flamingos, pintail ducks, and land iguanas. In the afternoon, travel by dinghy to Bartholomew Island and the famous Pinnacle Rock. Bartholomew consists of an extinct volcano with a variety of red, orange, black and even green volcanic formations. Take a trail of steps to the summit of the volcano where you will enjoy one of the best views of the islands. Visit a small, beautiful beach surrounded by the only vegetation on this barren island. The beach is perfect for snorkelling; you may even see and swim with Galapagos penguins.

CRUISE DAY 3 - This morning, visit Vicente Roca Point on Isabela Island. The two coves of Vicente Roca Point host spectacular sea life. Keep an eye out for seahorses, sea turtles, and the strange yet fascinating Mola Mola (or sun fish) while you snorkel. In the afternoon, cross the Bolivar Channel that divides Isabela and Fernandina Islands, to land at Espinoza Point. After walking past a colony of marine iguanas and a group of sea lions, you will reach the island’s highlight: the flightless cormorant nesting site.

CRUISE DAY 4 - Visit Tagus Cove on Isabela Island. This spot has been the anchorage site for ships since the 1800s. Follow the trails along Lake Darwin up to a ridge for wonderful island views. In the afternoon, visit the many islets of Elizabeth Bay by dinghy. Spot penguins and blue-footed boobies on the black rocks. With an abundance of marine life and clear water, the area is perfect for snorkelling and viewing schools of colourful fish, sea lions, and perhaps even sharks.

CRUISE DAY 5 - At Urbina Bay, at the base of Alcedo Volcano, see the exposed coastline, created when a major uplift in 1954 caused the land to rise over 16 feet. Snorkel in the clear waters. In the afternoon, visit Moreno Point, where the ground is formed of lava flows. The lava left craters in its wake which formed crystal tide pools. Peer through these openings into the the water below as the marine life below drifts by your window. In the brackish pools of this area, look for pink flamingos, white-cheeked pintails, and red-beaked gallinules. You may also see white-tip reef sharks and sea turtles.

CRUISE DAY 6 - Visit the Sierra Negra Volcano, the largest basaltic caldera in the Galapagos with a diameter of 6.2 miles (10 km). Hike to the caldera for impressive views across its glistening waters. Observe from here several species of finches, made famous by Darwin's explorations, and a rich display of vegetation. In the afternoon, visit the giant tortoise breeding centre, Arnaldo Tupiza. Here, tortoise populations from across the Galapagos are protected and propagated. See their 330 juvenile and adult tortoises.

CRUISE DAY 7 - Snorkel around Devil’s Crown - the rocky remains of an offshore volcano protruding from the water. This is a great location to spot a wide range of marine creatures. Afterwards, head to a large lagoon with flocks of pink flamingoes at Cormorant Point. The beaches on this island are distinct: Green Beach is so-named due to the high percentage of olivine crystals in the sand, and Flour Sand Beach is composed of white coral. In the afternoon, visit Post Office Bay, where you'll land on a beach and head to a spot where 18th century whalers placed a wooden barrel to be used as an unofficial mail box. The custom continues to this day with Galapagos visitors. So, don’t forget your postcards, and don’t be surprised if the post card arrives at its destination before you even get home!

CRUISE DAY 8 - Visit Mosquera Islet with its reef of rocks and coral. This island has one of the largest populations of sea lions and is home to many shorebirds. There have been occasional reports at this site of orcas feeding on sea lions. After this final excursion, you will be transferred to Baltra Airport in time for your flight back to Quito on the mainland, and transferred to your hotel.
FLY TO MEDELLIN, COLOMBIA: You will be transferred to Quito airport for your flight to Colombia. At Medellin airport you will be greeted by a representative who will transfer you to your hotel.

MEDELLIN PRIVATE GUIDED CITY TOUR - COMUNA 13, BOTANICAL GARDENS, SCULPTURE PARK: Dive deeper into the social development of Medellin with your private guide, exploring Comuna 13. This transformed neighbourhood used to be one of Medellin’s most troubled. Private and government investment, and social initiatives, have turned things around. Wander through the neighbourhood to see displays of graffiti art spreading positive messages, breakdance, musicians and DJs, all inspired to create a sense of unity in the community.

FLY TO PEREIRA - COLOURFUL COFFEE VILLAGES: You will be greeted at Pereira airport and privately transferred to your hacienda in charming Salento: a 19th Century town with atmospheric alleys squeezed in between terracotta-roofed houses and with the peaks of the Andes visible in the distance. En-route stop at Filandia, a charming and authentic town with brightly painted homes, bustling streets, and plenty of great little cafes and eateries.

BAMBOO RAFTING ON LA VIEJA RIVER: Today's adventure begins properly in Quimbaya, one of many small but charming towns in the region. You’ll be kitted out with safety gear and be whisked by Colombian Jeep Willys to the rivers’ edge, where your raft will be waiting. The raft is made from Guadua bamboo and, although simple, does have seating. Sit back and enjoy the gentle ride, observing birds and cattle as you travel. Cool off with a swim or simply drift along, soaking it all in. Enjoy a traditional 'fiambre' lunch of rice, chicken, plantain and cassava wrapped in a bihao leaf.

CORCORA VALLEY TOWERING PALMS & HUMMINGBIRD RESERVE: Start with a scenic hike in the Corcora Valley, to where endemic palms trees, the tallest in the world, tower overhead. Afterwards, hike through Acaime Reserve to spot 12 different species of hummingbird.

FLY TO BOGOTA: Look past the chaos of this large city and there are some rather charming discoveries to be made. The many neighbourhoods that comprise the centre each have a personality of their own and it takes some wandering around to get under the skin of each. There’s fantastic nightlife and dining options across the city but Colombia’s elite tend to hang out in the lively bars or elegant restaurants of the Zona Rosa. La Candelaria offers a glimpse into Bogota’s colonial history, its cobbled streets home to many of the city’s best museums, beautiful old homes, theatres, and churches.

FLY TO LA MACARENA - BOAT RIDE & 'LIQUID RAINBOW': Settle into your rustic lodge in La Macarena National Park. Take a wooden boat along the Guayabero River, on the way to the rainbow coloured riverbeds of Caño Cristales. Hike from a farmer's house up to a lookout over the forest. Continue your trek to swim in the vibrant natural pools of Caño Cristales, 'the Liquid Rainbow', with its multicoloured algae giving the water its hues from Aug-Nov.

SIERRA HIKING & WATERFALLS: Hike in the Sierra de la Macarena National Park, bathe in natural pools, trek to waterfalls, and admire curious rock formations. Visit a different stretch of the colourful Caño Cristales river.

SUNRISE ON GUAYABERO RIVER; FLY TO CARTAGENA: Enjoy the sunrise over the Guayabero River. Fly on to Cartagena: one of Colombia's jewels with well-preserved colonial architecture. Wander its cobbled streets of balconied homes, impressive churches and plazas.

GUIDED WALK OF CARTAGENA OLD TOWN; SALSA CLASS: Cartagena is like a living museum, with its historic architecture and blend of European, Caribbean and African cultures. Your private guide will introduce you to its history and legends. Explore the walled city, churches and plazas, sipping on fresh fruit juice from street vendors on the way. AFTERNOON: Learn to salsa the Colombian way with a private dance class led by local experts.

DAY AT LEISURE IN CARTAGENA: Wandering through Cartagena is a joy in itself. But if you feel like mixing things up, you could take a horse and cart around the centre, visit the fortress that overlooks the city, or organise a boat trip to the snorkelling paradise and beaches of the Rosario Islands.
DEPARTURE DAY: You will be privately transferred from your hotel to the airport for your flight home.

generalInfo: Join us for a 4-day adventure to Guaviare and explore the natural wonders of this region. Discover the ancient legends of the Gate of Orion and marvel at the stunning Black Lagoon or Red River. Hike through the breathtaking landscapes of Cerro Azul and witness the region's unique flora and fauna. Get up close with the friendly pink dolphins in Nare Lagoon and learn about their habitats and behaviors. Experience the cultural richness of Nuevo Tolima and taste the local cuisine. Our package includes comfortable accommodation and all meals, so you can relax and fully immerse yourself in this unforgettable adventure. Don't miss this chance to explore the hidden gems of Guaviare.

dayInfo.description: Enjoy a relaxing 1 hr flight to San Jose. There are limited flights to San Jose and you'll be arriving at approximately 10:53 am. On arrival, you'll be collected from the airport and taken directly on your tour. You'll travel a short distance to arrive at the fascinating area of rock formations such as the Puerta de Orio´n (Gate of Orion). Red River (July to October): Here you'll enjoy walking through this wonderful area for approximately 2km (1.25 mi) before heading to Caño Sabana to enjoy the wonderful scenery of this magical river which displays the colorful water plant Macarenia clavíagera. (Colombia is the only country in the world to have this beautiful plant.) Black Lagoon (November till June) Here you'll enjoy a short boat ride, view monkeys in the nearby trees, and a wonderful abundance of birds flying around. You'll also have the opportunity to enjoy a swim in these refreshing waters.

Leaving shortly after breakfast at around 7:30 am you'll travel for approximately 2 hours to get to the archeological site of Cerro Azul. Once here you'll be walking through a natural jungle and a cave measuring 210m (688ft). This is also where you'll enjoy your first encounter with the rock paintings of animals, people, plants, and daily life dating back more than 12000 years bp. NB. This walk is rated a 3 out of 5 for difficulty. Following this, you'll be heading off to enjoy a late lunch of the region before traveling back to your hotel and expected arrival of 4:30pm

Leaving before breakfast around 5:30 am you'll journey in a 4x4 for 2.5-3 hours to the Laguna Damas de Nare. (Stopping for breakfast along the way) Once here you'll enjoy an hour's walk (with a few stops) for approximately 3.5km (2 mi) through a beautiful natural forest full of exotic plants, birds, and monkeys. At the conclusion of this walk, you'll stop for a short break before climbing into a canoe to explore the lagoon in search of the Pink Dolphins.

Today will start with a relaxing journey of approximately 95 min to the Pinturas Rupestres Nuevo Tolima. That is a 60 min drive and a 35 min hike. Although it is a short hike it is mostly uphill, so a basic-medium level of fitness will be required. But once you arrive at the site it'll all be worthwhile. You'll actually only find one rock face with paintings here, but it is longer than either of the walls at Cerro Azul. Not only that, but it's less visited and usually less crowded. Estimations of these rock paintings are up to 12,500 years BP. After your morning tour and some lunch, it'll be off to the airport to catch your flight back to Bogotá.

tourName: Highlights of Colombia with added comfort
generalInfo:
Experience the best of Colombia's rich contrasts on this one-week trip. Explore lively and colourful cities, rolling coffee-covered hills and the tropical Caribbean coast, all whilst experiencing the warm and welcoming spirit of the Colombian people.

The Coffee Region - Stroll amongst orchids and hummingbirds and sip specialist coffee in this UNESCO World Heritage area
Medellin - Uncover how this lively modern city has transformed its reputation from the days of Pablo Escobar
Cartagena - Wander the cobbled streets of this Caribbean colonial gem and enjoy sundowners on the beach
Upgraded Range - Immerse yourself in Colombia's rich history and colourful culture whilst staying in our hand-picked selection of Premium hotels

dayInfo.title: Join trip in Bogota
dayInfo.description: : Our tour starts in Bogota, the beating heart of Colombia. The lofty capital is cradled by the high ranges of the Cordillera Mountains, blanketing the Andean peaks with an eclectic mix of historic buildings and urban architecture. Its name comes from the Muisca indigenous people who inhabited the region before the arrival of the Spaniards in 1538, and the remnants of not only the Muisca empire but of Colombia's many other indigenous cultures can be found in the city's impressive Gold Museum. For those arriving on time, our Tour Leader plans to meet you in the hotel reception at 6pm for the welcome meeting, after which we will go out for dinner. There are no activities planned today, so you're free to arrive in Bogota at any time. If you'd like an airport transfer today, you'll need to arrive into Bogota's El Dorado International Airport (BOG), approximately a 45-minute drive from our hotel. As part of our Upgraded range, we also offer a complimentary transfer to those who have made pre-tour accommodation arrangements through Explore, regardless of your arrival day. If you miss the meeting, our tour leader will inform you of any essential information as soon as you catch up. If your flight arrives earlier in the day, head out to explore the colourful streets of La Candelaria, where you'll find museums, bars and restaurants dotted between colonial convents and churches. It's a great spot to orientate yourself and get a snapshot of local life. Our time in Bogota is limited, so if you would like to spend some more time exploring Colombia's capital we'd recommend arriving 1-2 nights before the tour starts and booking pre-tour accommodation.

dayInfo.title: Fly to Pereira and explore the coffee region with coffee tasting at Finca Del Cafe
dayInfo.description: : After a leisurely breakfast we make our way to the airport this morning for our flight into Colombia's coffee region. Pereira is the capital of the Risaralda department, a key centre within the renowned coffee cultural landscape of Colombia and a UNESCO World Heritage site. Pereira sits in the foothills of the Andes mountain range and with its latitude, approximately 4 degrees north of the equator, combined with an altitude of around 1,411m/4,629ft and a gentle subtropical highland climate, it has the ideal conditions for cultivating the high-quality Arabica coffee bean. Colombia is in the world's top three coffee producers and is celebrated for producing some of the finest brews, including the exceptional coffees originating from this region. After checking into our hotel, we'll head out this afternoon for a coffee tour at the Finca Del Cafe. We'll spend the afternoon learning about the whole process from the planting of the beans all the way through the picking and roasting process. We'll try out 'cupping', a technique used to distinguish aroma, body and acidity, before finishing off with trying two different specialist coffees. Our hotel for the next two nights sits in the heart of coffee country, in an enviable location that affords wide sweeping views out the lush rolling hills and mountains beyond. The Casa's wooden construction is full of local character and interesting decor, and it has a large swimming pool to relax in after a day's exploring.

dayInfo.title: Take an orchid tour in the gardens of Finca Romelia. Free afternoon in the coffee region
dayInfo.description: : This morning we'll head out to Finca Romelia, a one hour scenic drive past plantations and lush rolling hills. The orchid is the national flower of Colombia, said to represent the country's beauty in diversity with over 4,000 different species found across the country. Finca Romelia possesses one of the largest orchid collections in Colombia and here we take a gentle walk through the farm's beautiful surroundings alongside an in-house botanist. The walk takes us through shaded forests and into teeming gardens packed with bonsai trees and of course, orchids. It's also a haven for birdlife, with over 70 species having been identified here with hummingbirds, toucans and tanagers often sighted. We'll make our way through the expansive orchid nursery before enjoying a hearty lunch in the farmhouse with the Londoño family, the owners of the finca who have lived and worked here for over 45 years. This afternoon has been left free to relax in the beautiful surroundings, or you might like to take a half day tour to nearby town of Salento, known for it's colourful houses set amongst towering wax palms of the Cocora Valley.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Medellin. Free afternoon in the 'City of Eternal Spring'
dayInfo.description: : Leaving early this morning we'll drive north to Medellin, a journey of around six hours including stops. Once a city overshadowed by its past, Medellin has transformed itself into one of South America's most vibrant, trendy cities - where gritty street art meets sleek cable cars, and traditional plazas buzz with the energy of a city on the move, all set to the musical backdrop of reggaeton and salsa. After checking in, we'll have some time to relax in the comfortable surroundings of our hotel, or there is the option to explore a little of the 'City of Eternal Spring', so-called due to its temperate year-round climate. Our accommodation for the next two nights is a boutique eco property located in the heart of the city, an ideal base from which to explore. Its decor is earthy yet modern and rooms are well appointed with outside spaces to relax.

dayInfo.title: Explore Medellin on foot and by cable car, including a visit to Comuna 13
dayInfo.description: : We'll spend today discovering Medellín's past and present with a local guide. We'll travel by private transport, on foot and by cable car. The tour aims to give the historical perspective behind Pablo Escobar's residency in Medellin, including what it was like when he was alive, and the changes that have made it the modern and diverse city it is today. We'll visit his old home, and the Casa de la Memoria Museum, an initiative started by the victims of the drug traffic trade that contributed to overcoming the conflict in Medellin. We will also visit the Parque Memorial la Inflexion, built where the Monaco building, Escobar's property, was located until its demolition in 2019. There were as many as 46,000 victims of narcotraffico in Colombia, and this park was built in their memory. This tour isn't designed to glorify Escobar's lasting imprint on the city, but to memorialise the people affected by the drug trade and to celebrate the modern face of Medellín. We'll also visit the outlying suburb of the once-notorious Comuna 13. This barrio, clinging to Medellín's western slopes, perfectly personifies Medellín's turn-around, once among the most feared neighbourhoods, it is now a vibrant and colourful community that is brimming with life. We take a tour of of the neighbourhood with Son Bata, an organisation that has worked to turn kids away from crime and towards music and the creative arts. We'll walk the winding staircases alongside colourful graffiti murals and past pop-up dance performances, giving us a real insight into local life here.

dayInfo.title: Free morning in Medellin, then fly to Cartagena on the Caribbean coast
dayInfo.description: : This morning has been left free to soak up more of this lively city. There is the option to visit the nearby picturesque lakeside town of Guatape, where the houses are painted in glorious pastel shades. It's known as the 'Pueblo de Zocalos' for the intricate paintings of animals, musical instruments, flowers and birds found on the lower half of almost every building in the centre. The cobblestoned streets are alive with colourful architecture and locals going about their daily business. In the afternoon, we will travel to the airport and fly to Cartagena on the shores of the Caribbean Sea. Depending on the flight schedules, we should arrive late in the evening and will transfer straight to our hotel. Our base for the next two nights is a beautifully appointed hotel in the heart of the old town. 18th century colonial architecture mixes with comfortable modern furnishings to make for a memorable stay. The hotel also features a swimming pool, a Turkish bath and is a short walk from Cartagena's lively bars and restaurants.

dayInfo.title: Walking tour of colonial Cartagena. Sunset dinner in fishing village of La Boquilla
dayInfo.description: : Cartagena is a wonderful place to get lost in, with old plazas and churches galore, as well as plenty of cafes, restaurants, markets and a warm, welcoming atmosphere around every corner. Today we'll take in the main sights on foot today. This afternoon is free to relax in the comfortable confines of the hotel, or perhaps to further explore Cartagena. For those who'd like to go outside the city walls, you may want to take a taxi ride to visit the hilltop convent of Santa Cruz de la Popa, with its panoramic views of the city, or the 16th-century fortress of San Felipe. In the early evening, we'll take a short drive out to nearby La Boquilla. Now an offshoot of Cartagena itself, this one-time fishing village still has a hint of its past and the residents balance their fishing heritage with tourism. There are fantastic sunsets from here, and we'll have our final drinks and dinner at the beach, before returning to our hotel for the evening.

dayInfo.title: Trip ends in Cartagena
dayInfo.description: : The trip ends after breakfast at our hotel in Cartagena. There are no activities planned today, so you're free to depart from Cartagena at any time. If your flight is departing later in the day, luggage storage facilities are available at our hotel. If you'd like an airport transfer today, you'll need to depart from Cartagena's Rafael Nunez International Airport (CTG), approximately a 20-minute drive from our hotel. As part of our Upgraded range, we also offer a complimentary transfer to those who have made post-tour accommodation arrangements through Explore, regardless of your departure day.

tourName: Learn Spanish in Colombia & highlights holiday
generalInfo: Discover the highlights of Colombia during a thrilling week-long tour. Start your adventure in Bogotá, exploring the historic La Candelaria neighborhood and the fascinating Gold Museum. Next, the city of Medellín, where you can admire its innovative urban transformation, Finally, head to the coastal gem of Cartagena, with its well-preserved architecture and vibrant street life.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL IN BOGOTA Our dedicated driver will be ready to escort you to your chosen accommodation

CITY TOUR IN BOGOTA DOWNTOWN This day, our guide will take you to the most famous places in Bogota downtown. A walking tour through the main square, Gold Museum, Monserrate hill, etc will be part of this first day in one of the most beautiful cities in South America

FLIGHT TO MEDELLIN Today, you will have some free hours to explore the area by your own. According to the flight departure time, our driver will meet you at the accommodation and will take you to the airport.

FULL DAY TOUR MEDELLIN You will enjoy a city tour in Medellin, to know some cultural attractions such as the Botero square where you can take pictures of his famous sculptures; also you reach the Nutibara park, to know more about the Paisas culture. To finish, a visit to the famous Comuna 13 and its sttunning graffitis, will take place in the afternoon.

FLIGHT TO CARTAGENA Private transfer from the hotel in Medellin, to the airport. Flight to Cartagena. Once you arrive to this enchanted city the private transfer will drive you to the hotel. After the check-in, you will have free time to enjoy the coffee shops and restaurants of the area.

WALKING TOUR IN CARTAGENA Cartagena de Indias is without a doubt one of the most beautiful cities in America. In this City Tour where you will discover its historic downtown, walled by the fortifications built-in the colonial time, still preserves its original architecture and nowadays the walled city is shown in an endless number of colors that fill it with life and Caribbean charm.
FREE DAY: Today you will have free time to discover new sites on your own.

SPANISH CLASSES & CULTURE: Embark on a linguistic voyage in the heart of Cartagena. Nestled amidst the charm of this coastal gem, this classes offer an immersive experience like no other. Learn the language of passion and culture in an environment pulsating with history and vibrant street life. The expert instructors guide you through personalized lessons tailored to your proficiency level, ensuring rapid progress and a deep understanding of the Spanish language. Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, We invite you to dive into the rhythm of Cartagena while mastering Español.
INTERNATIONAL DEPARTURE This day, a private transportation will take you to the airport to catch your internacional flight back home. End of services

generalInfo:
This expedition takes travellers through the most contrasting destinations in Colombia: Bogota’s cosmopolitan restaurants and neighbourhoods, the Coffee Region’s verdant hills and lush nature, Cartagena’s streets lined with colourful mansions, and the Rosario Islands’ turquoise waters. Get a taste of the Colombia’s incredible diversity and breathtaking landscapes, through authentic and personalized experiences with local experts.

Colombia is in the midst of a new era in its history. It has one of the top regional economies and is one of the most politically stable countries in Latin America. The significant improvement in the country’s safety has also positioned Colombia as a top travel destination. Boasting beaches on the Caribbean Sea and the Pacific Ocean, as well as the stunning Andes mountain region and the legendary Amazon rainforest, Colombia is proud to be the second most biodiverse country in the world. Furthermore, booming cosmopolitan cities like Bogotá, Medellin, and Cartagena can impress anyone with their magnificent views, innovative architecture, rich culture, exceptional restaurants, and enthralling ambience.

dayInfo.description: BOGOTA - A host and a driver will be waiting for you at Bogota Airport. Your host is a local who will introduce you to Bogota, and serve as a guide, translator and concierge. Enjoy the remainder of the afternoon at leisure. Founded in 1538 this cosmopolitan city of almost 8 million people, sits high up in the Andes Mountain Range – 8,660 feet (2,640 meters) above sea level. As the third highest capital city in South America. Before the Spanish arrival, various indigenous tribes inhabited Bogota and the region surrounding it. Remnants of these tribes can be seen in Bogota’s spectacular gold museum and in the traditions of the small rural communities. Bogota has been the epicentre of Colombia’s dramatic yet fascinating history, so visiting it is the best way to understand the country’s tough past and recent revival. Overnight Four Season Casa Medina

BOGOTA'S HISTORIC DISTRICT & MUSEUMS (B) - Travel through the winding streets of La Candelaria accompanied by a history expert and live the stories behind the streets, plazas, cathedrals and street art pieces you will see along the way. Your guide will not only give you an insight into the country’s history and architecture, but also into Colombia’s political and economic revival. Your next activity continues after your lunchbreak, visiting some of Bogota’s most important museums such as Botero Museum and the Gold Museum. In the evening, enjoy an exclusive dinner talking history, culture and the thrilling issues the country has faced with a political and economic expert of the country (cost of meal not included). Overnight Four Season Casa Medina

BOGOTA - COFFEE REGION (B) - Your chauffeur will drive you to the airport from where you will take a short flight to Pereira. The Coffee Triangle is not a city or a particular place. It is a beautiful blend of lush mountains, rich culture and incredibly kind people. The triangle consists of three states Quindio, Caldas and Risaralda. This region sits high up on the western Andes mountain range, where the altitude, climatic conditions and fertile terrain induce the production of what many consider to be the best coffee in the world. Visit a traditional coffee farm. The owner will walk you through the coffee plantation as he explains the intricate process of harvesting and producing coffee, from the seed to the cup. Enjoy the lush landscapes, exotic flowers and many birds that inhabit this area. Duration: 1-2 hours walk. Overnight Hotel Sazagua.

EXPLORE THE COCORA VALLEY & PLAY TEJO IN SALENTO (B) - The heart of the coffee region. Among the beauties of the Valle del Cocora, you will have a chance to admire the towering 60-meter palm trees and the lush colourful surroundings, as well as some of the locals who live by. Thanks to this site, the wax palm tree was recognized as the official tree of Colombia, and classified as a protected species. Spend the rest of the day exploring the towns of Salento, quaint little town in the heart of the coffee region and part of the UNESCO world heritage site of the Coffee Cultural Landscape of Colombia. There, get to play Tejo, the famous regional sport. Your tour continues then to Finlandia, an authentic colonial Andean town in the mountains where you will still be able to witness this unique Andean culture. Overnight Hotel Sazagua

COFFEE REGION - CARTAGENA (B) - Your private driver will be waiting for you at your hotel and will take you to the airport where you will take your flight to Cartagena. Cartagena, founded by Spanish explorers in 1533, is a stunning example of Spanish colonial architecture, African culture and Amerindian heritage. Its picturesque historic centre is enclosed by impressive fortifications that protected the city from pirates, but they now provide unparalleled views of the ocean. To top it off, Cartagena is the cultural hub of Colombia. Boasting premier literature, music and film festivals, along with traditional cultural celebrations, there is always something to see and do. Whatever you want, Cartagena has it all. Overnight Casa San Agustin

THE COLONIAL LEGACY OF CARTAGENA (B) - Taking advantage of the cooler morning hours, your history expert will lead you through the historic centre, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. There, you will learn about the colonization and the Inquisition era. Your visit continues accompanied by your history expert explaining the importance of the city’s strategic location during the Spanish colony. Drive to Castillo de San Felipe, to explore the dark tunnels and lookout points, and recount the stories and strategies used to defend Cartagena from invaders. Overnight Casa San Agustin

DISCOVERING ROSARIO ISLANDS (B) - Meet your host at the hotel lobby. Depart from your hotel in a private car that will take you to the dock, before you head off to Islas del Rosario on a private speedboat (28ft – 30ft). Spend the day cruising between islands, snorkelling among colourful reefs and enjoying the pristine waters of the Rosario Islands. The boat will be staffed with an English-speaking host and equipped with snorkelling equipment, water bottles, fresh fruit and snacks. Lunch will be arranged at one of the beach restaurants in the islands (not included). Overnight Casa San Agustin

RELAXING IN CARTAGENA (B) - Enjoy your morning at leisure wandering at your own pace in the historic centre. In the afternoon, meet your guide at the hotel lobby. A sommelier in Colombia will guide you through an exquisite tasting experience. Sample a variety of premium rums, understand how rum is processed and aged, and learn how to recognize its numerous characteristics. An English-speaking translator will be available. Overnight Casa San Agustin
CARTAGENA - BOGOTA (B) - Your private driver will be waiting for you at the lobby of your hotel and will drive you to Cartagena Airport. After a layover in Bogota, check-in for your next flight home.

OPTIONAL TAYRONA REGION EXTENSION - TAYRONA REGION (B,L,D) - Your private driver will be waiting for you at the lobby of Casa San Agustin and will drive you to your next destination in the Tayrona Region. The Tayrona National Park is located 4.5 hours driving from Cartagena, between white sand beaches and the foothills of the impressive Sierra Nevada. It is famous for its lush vegetation, beautiful virgin beaches and extraordinary biodiversity. The Tayrona region gets its name from the ancient Tayrona tribe, which ruled this area for many years. The original Tayrona civilization almost disappeared once the Spanish colonizers settled in Latin America in the 17th century. Part of it remains strong and alive through 4 indigenous tribes in the region who still maintain the culture, language, religion and traditions they inherited from the original Tayronas. After having settled in your hotel room, drive to the Don Diego region (approximately 30 minutes). After a 20-minute walk into the jungle, you will arrive at a river bank from where you will float down a crystalline river all the way down to the ocean. Along the way you will find exuberant vegetation, exotic birds and howler monkeys that will make this “mini river safari” worth it. Overnight at Merecumbe

EXPLORING TAYRONA NATIONAL RESERVE (B,L,D) - Drive to Tayrona Natural Reserve’s main entrance (15 minutes). Alongside a local English-speaking guide, go on a nature walk to explore various parts of the Tayrona Natural Reserve. Find monkeys, birds, and spectacular flora along the way. Explore rivers, jungles and small bays where one can take refreshing swims in the turquoise waters. For those with more physical endurance… Drive to Tayrona Natural Reserve’s Calabazo entrance (25 minutes). Trek to Chairama (Pueblito), the ruins of a small pre-Columbian indigenous city. You will be accompanied by a Wiwa tribe member who can provide insight into the history of the ruins and the tribe’s current culture, religion and traditions. Continue the walk down to the beautiful beaches of Cabo San Juan in Parque Tayrona. The trek is approximately 5-6 hours along an ancient path built by the Tayronas, and requires physical endurance. (Duration: full-day) Overnight Merecumbe

CULTURAL EXCHANGES WITH AN INDIGENOUS COMMUNITY IN TAYRONA (B,L,D) - Drive to the area of Rio Ancho, where the Sierra Nevada mountains meet the Caribbean beaches of La Guajira Department. Alongside an English-speaking guide and a member of the Kogui tribe, walk 2-hours beside the river banks of Ancho River, and arrive at a large Kogui village, hidden in the midst of this mountain range. Explore the village and learn about the Koguis’ traditions, beliefs and role as the elder brothers that protect mother nature. Overnight Merecumbe
END OF TRIP - Flight home.

tourName: Medellin, Santa Marta, and Cartagena tour
generalInfo:
Embark on a thrilling 13-day journey through Colombia that will take you to some of the most iconic destinations in the country. Your adventure begins in Medellin, where you'll receive a city tour and visit Comuna 13, a vibrant neighborhood that has undergone a remarkable transformation. You'll also get to taste some of the local fruits and experience the city's unique culinary culture.

You'll visit Guatape and spend the night there, next day you'll visit a cacao farm close to San Rafael and discover the secrets of one of Colombia's most treasured exports. You'll learn about the cultivation process and even get to taste some of the delicious chocolate made from cacao beans.

Next, you'll head to Santa Marta, a charming town situated on the Caribbean coast. Here, you'll visit the nearby town of Minca, known for its rich biodiversity, stunning waterfalls, and coffee plantations. You'll also get to experience the natural beauty of Cabo San Juan, a secluded beach located in the heart of the Tayrona National Natural Park. The beach is known for its crystal-clear waters, pristine white sands, and stunning natural surroundings. At Taironaka, you'll have the opportunity to explore the ancient ruins of the Tairona civilization, which date back over 1,000 years. You can choose to go down the Don Diego River by tubing, paddling, or taking a boat ride, passing through lush tropical forests and stunning landscapes, where you'll see a wide variety of wildlife and birds.

Finally, you'll visit Cartagena, a vibrant city steeped in history, culture, and tradition. You'll take a city tour and visit to the mangroves in la boquilla, where you'll learn about the unique culture of the Afro-Colombian community. You'll also get to explore the stunning Rosario Islands, a group of small coral islands located off the coast of Cartagena. Here, you can relax on the beautiful beaches, swim in crystal-clear waters, and explore the surrounding coral reefs. And, no visit to Cartagena would be complete without a trip to the bustling Bazurto Market, where you'll discover a vibrant and colorful world of exotic fruits, vegetables, seafood, and meats.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at any time to be collected from the airport and taken to your accommodation. Depending on your arrival time we can provide you with another tour or with suggestions of places to see and where to go. (Overnight Medellin)

Experience the vibrant and colorful city of Medellin through a comprehensive city tour that takes you to some of the city's most iconic landmarks.. Next, explore the streets of Comuna 13, a neighborhood that has transformed itself from a place of violence to a hub of creativity and community, adorned with colorful murals and street art. Finish off your day with a visit to the bustling Bazurto Market, where you'll indulge in fruit tasting and discover the exotic and delicious flavors of Colombia's tropical fruits. (Overnight Medellin)

Explore the picturesque town of Guatape and climb the famous Piedra del Peñol. Learn about the history of the Old Peñol Replica Town and the submerged village at the bottom of the Peñol-Guatapé reservoir. Experience breathtaking panoramic views from the top of Guatape Rock and stroll through the City of Zocalos. Finish off the day by checking into your hotel and relaxing by the lake. (Overnight Guatape)

Embark on a chocolate lover's paradise with a trip to a Cocoa Finca near San Rafael. Indulge in a delicious breakfast before exploring the cocoa plantation with a guided hike, encountering tropical birds and playful monkeys along the way. Enjoy a traditional lunch before learning how to create your very own chocolate bar using artisanal methods. After a refreshing swim in the Arenales river, you'll head back to your hotel in Medellín with unforgettable memories of your sweet adventure. (Overnight Medellin)

Enjoy a short flight to Santa Marta arriving around mid-afternoon. Your transport will be waiting to collect you and take you directly to your hotel. Depending on the hotel-style you choose, you will be staying in the Historic Sector of Santa Marta or next to Tayrona National Park.

Travel to the small town of Minca where you'll breathe in the fresh mountain air and enjoy a tour of this wonderful little mountain pueblo, including its wonderful cafes and artisan shops. Following this, you'll receive a coffee tour, where you'll learn everything about the production of Colombian liquid gold, from the seed to the cup. Next, you are off on a mountain adventure you'll explore some hidden waterfalls, with the opportunity for a refreshing swim (don't forget your swimming trunks)! Of course, throughout your journey, you need to keep an eye out for any exotic birds that happen to be hanging out close by!
Free day or optional tour to Cabo San Juan

Explore the beautiful Rio Don Diego and Tayronaka on a guided tour from your Santa Marta hotel. Learn about the ancestral history of the Kogui indigenous people and the entire Americas during a museum visit and a walk through the ancient ruins. Meet the Kogui community and receive an "aseguranza" to safeguard you on future travels. Enjoy a delicious lunch before kayaking, paddleboarding, or tubing down the river to the Caribbean Sea. End the day with beach time and a stunning sunset.

Relax in a morning drive along the coast to your waiting hotel in Cartagena. Once here you’ll check into your hotel and enjoy some Free Time before your 4pm city tour. You'll explore the charming colonial streets, plazas, restaurants, cafes, and bars within the walled city, along with one of the oldest and most bohemian neighborhoods in Cartagena. Visit the iconic landmarks such as the Clock Tower monument, Bolivar Park, Plaza Saint Pedro Claver, Plaza de Los Jagüeyes, San Diego, and the colorful streets of Gertsemani while learning about the city's historic struggle between the Spanish colonialists and pirates from different nations. (Overnight Cartagena)

Enjoy a wonderful ocean cruise on a speedboat to the Rosario Islands; arriving at a beautiful picturesque beach for a typical Caribbean lunch, crystal clear waters, water-sports, white sands, and palm trees. You'll be assigned your personal beach space which will be exclusive for yourself and members of your group. (Overnight Cartagena)

Experience the beauty of the mangroves on an authentic wooden canoe ride with a local fisherman. Immerse yourself in Afro-Colombian culture by learning about traditional rhythms like Cumbia and El Bullerengue, and take a drum workshop with experienced instructors. Discover the history and techniques of drumming, and learn to play the Gaitas and Maracas to the beat of the music. Join in on the dance floor and watch a professional performance to complete your unforgettable experience. (Overnight Cartagena)

Explore the vibrant streets and graffiti-filled neighborhoods of Cartagena with a bilingual guide, discovering hidden cafes, bars, and restaurants. Then, venture into the bustling Colombian markets of Bazurto, where you'll learn about the daily lives of hard-working Colombians and sample exotic tropical fruits and freshly cut meats. Enjoy an authentic lunch at a local restaurant and browse the artisan and community area, complete with games and hand-painted posters. End your day by watching one of the world's most beautiful sunsets aboard a catamaran on Cartagena's bay. A truly romantic and unforgettable experience. (Overnight Cartagena)
Hablamos pronto, safe travels home, and visit again soon! We’ll have transport waiting to take you to the airport at your desired time.

tourName: Off the beaten track holiday to Colombia
placesVisited: Bogotá, San Agustín, Coffee & subsistence farm tours, Salento, Valle de Cocora, Tayrona National Park, Santa Marta, Aracataca, Mompós, Cartagena, Optional: La Sabana, Zipaquirá salt mine, Guatavita Lagoon, jeep tour of Magdalena Canyon, Calarca Botanical Gardens, horse riding excursion, Rosario Islands
generalInfo:
Off limits to travellers for many years, Colombia has long been misunderstood, but now that doors are opening to holidaymakers once again, travellers are returning from this incredible country and raving about all that it has to offer. While still hardly a mainstream travel destination, this off the beaten track holiday to Colombia takes you to many of the country’s even less visited regions as well as the classic draws of colonial Cartagena and Tayrona National Park.

Travelling as part of a small group enables you to stray from the traditional tourist trail with private transport, internal flights and a tour leader to take care of the language barrier and recommend places to eat and optional excursions. Free time is built in for you to relax, wander or take additional guided tours. Visit remote village, including Aractataca – the birthplace of Gabriel García Márquez, whose family home is now a museum. Travel on to the sleepy village of Mompós, which will make you feel like you’ve stepped into one of his surreal novels. Explore the stunning Cordillera Central, visit coffee farms and see archaeological remains from an ancient civilisation about which much remains unknown.

Head back into more familiar territory in Santa Marta and the stunning Tayrona National Park, where thick jungle meets Caribbean coast. This Colombia holiday ends in the unbelievably romantic city of Cartagena, the setting for another of García Márquez’s novels, and whose cobbled streets an horse drawn carts make you feel like you have stepped back in time a century or more. If this laidback city is still not quite tranquil enough, take a daytrip out to the castaway-style Islas del Rosario, just a short boat ride away.

dayInfo.title: City tour, including a visit to the Gold Museum.
dayInfo.description: If arriving on an overnight international flight will be met at the airport early in the morning and escorted to your hotel where your room will be waiting for you to rest for a few hours. Bogotá is a city of sparkling prosperity, oppressive poverty, and everything in between. Its centre is awash with splendid colonial churches, fascinating museums, futuristic architecture and lively universities. Its population is diverse and engaging and its cultural life vibrant. There is a guided tour of the city, including the fascinating colonial area of Candelaria with its fine historic buildings lining cobbled streets. The tour culminates with a visit to the excellent Gold Museum, housing more than 34,000 gold pieces and arguably the most impressive museum of its kind in the world.

dayInfo.title: Optional excursions in and around Bogotá.
dayInfo.description: You have the option to head into the attractive La Sabana countryside, dotted with greenhouses that assist the region’s lucrative cut-flower industry. Zipaquirá is home to a still functioning, centuries-old salt mine. Nearly 200m beneath the earth is an extraordinary, mysterious salt cathedral, its vast pillars and walls made from glistening salt. There are 14 stations of the cross sculpted by different Colombian artists. The excursion continues across some beautiful countryside to the Guatavita Lagoon. There is a hike to the crater-lake’s 3,100m rim, offering wonderful views. Legend has it that this was the site of legendary El Dorado. The ancient Chibcha king was thought to have been doused in sap and gold dust and pushed out onto the lake’s calm waters in a ceremonial raft, from which he would submerge himself, rinsing off this valuable body paint. Other precious objects were believed to have been thrown into the lake as offerings, and a number have been recovered and are housed in the gold museum in Bogotá.

dayInfo.title: Fly to Neiva, by road to San Agustín.
dayInfo.description: Transfer to the airport for a flight to Neiva (1 hour), then there’s a pleasant 4 hour drive past coffee plantations and undulating green hills to San Agustín. This pretty little town is your base for the next 3 nights, and has a smattering of attractive colonial houses and churches, cobbled streets and shady plazas.

dayInfo.title: Archaeological park visit.
dayInfo.description: Today there is an excursion to the archaeological park, about 3km from the town. Here more than 100 statues, some of which are thought to date back to 3,300BC, stand amid the forested countryside. Alongside them are circular burial houses, only about a third of which have been excavated, into which human sacrifices and offerings to the gods were made. Little is known about the culture which produced these stone figures, but it is an impressive site in beautiful countryside and there are hiking opportunities into the surrounding area, including to the Fuente de Lavapatas, where stream water runs through channels carved into the stone.

dayInfo.title: Tour of Magdalena Gorge and surrounding area.
dayInfo.description: A day trip takes you by through sugar plantations and up and down steep gorges to the Magdalena Canyon. Here you can see huge figures carved into rocks midway up the canyon wall, with the river crashing below, and some free-standing stones sculpted into rudimentary animal shapes.

dayInfo.title: Drive to colonial Popayán.
dayInfo.description: It’s a beautiful and varied road through rugged hills which first climbs and then descends through cattle pastures and crinkled bright green hills to the university town of Popayán (4-5hrs). Popayán is a stately colonial town which has maintained its character in spite of devastating earthquakes. For many years during the troubles the city was off limits; now it is safe but still relatively undiscovered by tourists, a pleasant change from many popular, equally exquisite Spanish cities in Latin America and a fantastic place to spend the night.

dayInfo.title: Travel to the Coffee Region. Visit Salento and Valle de Cocora.
dayInfo.description: We continue on by road (5hrs) to the heart of the countries coffee region. You spend 3 days in this beautiful, relaxing area, with walking trails, colourful flora and fauna and fresh coffee at your fingertips. Time will be spent at a coffee ranch and there is a guided tour of a local farm, where you gain an insight into subsistence agriculture in the region. Learn about fruit production and tropical flower cultivation as well as the intricacies of the coffee production process, including the picking, de-pulping, washing, drying and roasting of the beans. There are opportunities to sample the final product. There is also the chance to drive out to traditional village Salento, its houses adorned with balconies bursting with flowers, and with wonderful views of the Cordillera Central emerging from behind elegant colonial buildings. Continue to Valle de la Cocora, a beautiful nature reserve which is home to the wax palm, Colombia’s national tree and the only palm which grows above 3,000m. Follow a well-marked path up the valley and look out over the mountains’ verdant foothills, and the cultivated patchwork of fields made up of a dozen shades of green. On the last day in the region there is the opportunity to visit the Botanical Gardens at Calarca. A series of nature trails pass abundant tropical flowers and there is an excellent insect museum and enclosed butterfly garden. Alternatively, you may prefer to take a horse-riding excursion from a nearby farm to explore the surrounding countryside.

dayInfo.title: Fly to Santa Marta and visit the Tayrona National Park.
dayInfo.description: Travel back to Armenia before boarding a flight via Bogota to the Caribbean coast and the city of Santa Marta. Santa Marta is South America’s oldest surviving colonial city and it’s spruced up town centre offers small scale historic charm as well as some great restaurants, bars and cafés. It is probably most famous for being where the great liberator Simon Bolivar was born. From here it’s a short journey to the incredible Parque Nacional Tayrona. There is a full day trip to this dazzling region of thick, humid jungle and exquisite unspoiled beaches fringed by coconut palms and peppered with vast, smooth boulders. It was once home to the indigenous Tayrona indians. Jungle paths follow tree-covered trails surrounded by tropical dry forest, with monkeys swinging in the trees overhead and the atmosphere heavy with heat. There are a number of restaurants and bars in the park where you can stop for lunch in the shade and take in your exotic surroundings. Of course if you’d rather have the day to explore or relax in Santa Marta then this can easily be arranged locally.

dayInfo.title: By private bus to Aracataca, birthplace of Gabriel García Márquez. Continue to Mompos.
dayInfo.description: A private bus then takes you inland to the small provincial town of Aracataca (2 hours). The town is famous as the birth place of Gabriel García Márquez, and provides a good place to stop for lunch. Márquez is arguably Latin America’s most famous writer and his works; (including ‘One Hundred Years of Solitude’) often feature in lists of the greatest novels ever written. He was born in Aracataca in 1927, and his birthplace features in some of his stories as the fictional town of Macondo. Today the family house he was raised in is a museum, and you will have time to visit the home of the Nobel Prize winning author. A further 5 hour journey past banana and oil palm plantations leads to the small provincial town of Mompos. Situated on the eastern banks of the Magdalena River, this 16th-century town is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one feels as if transported into a Gabriel García Marquez novel, wandering streets fronted by whitewashed colonial buildings and mansions which were once home to powerful Spanish merchants (for whom the town was an important stopping-off point on the trade route to Cartagena). Spend 2 days in these beautiful surroundings, relaxing in the shady plazas, lapping up the atmosphere, and enjoy the natural scenery on the river banks on an included boat trip.

dayInfo.title: Travel by private vehicle to Cartagena.
dayInfo.description: The day is spent travelling back by private vehicle to the Caribbean coast and the famous city of Cartagena.

dayInfo.title: Explore one of Latin America's most interesting and famous cities - Cartagena.
dayInfo.description: Caribbean’s most exotic and romantic colonial city, Cartagena was founded in 1533, quickly blossoming to become the main Spanish port in the Caribbean, and a gateway to the north of the continent. Treasure plundered from native inhabitants was stored here until the galleons could ship it back to Spain, and it therefore became a tempting target for pirates. In order to protect their booty, the Spanish constructed an elaborate system of ramparts, which still encircle the town. Today, while Cartagena has expanded dramatically, the walled centre has changed very little, allowing a glimpse of 16th and 17th-century Spanish architecture and town planning. Enjoy the shade provided by the buildings in these labyrinthine, cobbled streets, and explore the monasteries, palaces, churches, plazas and imposing mansions where the overhanging balconies are heavy with flowers. Beyond this, the city opens up: an eclectic and seductive mix of Caribbean and African influences produces a vibrant street life, with fruit stalls lining the roads and pulsating rhythms emerging from cars and houses. A guided tour will help you soak up the atmosphere of this unique city.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Cartagena airport. Depart for international flight.

tourName: Peru and Colombia tailor made tour
generalInfo:
Embark on a 12-day adventure that interweaves the cultural highlights of Peru and the vibrant allure of Colombia. In Peru, journey from the modern city of Lima to ancient Machu Picchu, visiting picturesque towns like Pisac. Explore the dramatic Sacred Valley, visit the circular agricultural terraces of Moray and shimmering salt mines of Maras. Experience the imposing blend of Inca ruins and mountain backdrop at Machu Picchu before the final stop in enigmatic Cusco with its magnificent Plaza de Armas.

Next, uncover Colombia's treasures, from Bogotá's colonial La Candelaria to the rolling hills of the Coffee Triangle. Explore the coffee ‘fincas’ and the misty cloud forests including the unique wax palms of the Valle del Cocora. Conclude in lively Cartagena, with its stunning Caribbean vistas, colourful architecture and historic fortress walls.

This adventure reveals the ancient legacies, vibrant cultures, and dramatic landscapes of Peru and Colombia.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVE LIMA - On arrival you will be warmly welcomed by our local representative and transferred to Villa Barranco. This charming boutique hotel in located in the heart of bohemian neighbourhood of Barranco. The rest of the day is at leisure.

LIMA - CUSCO - SACRED VALLEY - Take the short flight from Lima to Cusco, in the heart of the Andes. Transfer through dramatic mountain landscapes to Pisac, home to a stunning Inca archaeological site in the Sacred Valley. At the Inkari Museum, learn about Peru's pre-Hispanic history then visit the Museum of Living Culture in Yucay to meet llamas and alpacas, see traditional Andean textiles woven, and learn indigenous dyeing techniques. Spend the next two nights at the boutique Andenia Hotel, nestled in the breathtaking Sacred Valley of the Incas near the town of Huycho.

SACRED VALLEY - Discover the circular terraces of Moray, an Inca agricultural laboratory for testing crops in varied microclimates. Next, witness the dazzling sight of thousands of shimmering salt mines at Maras contrasted against the Sacred Valley's dramatic backdrop. Finally, explore picturesque Ollantaytambo, a living Inca town, and its imposing hilltop fortress. Over the day, this tour through the highlights of the Sacred Valley reveals the ingenious agricultural science, dramatic landscapes and enduring culture of the Incas.

MACHU PICCHU - Journey by train through the spectacular Andes to the magnificent Lost City of the Incas, Machu Picchu. As you explore this UNESCO World Heritage Site, stand in awe before the ancient terraces, stairways and urban areas that emanate an incredible energy and history. After your guided tour of Machu Picchu, return by train to the Sacred Valley and transfer to Cusco. Settle into the charm of boutique Quinta San Blas. Let the comforts of this central Cusco hotel be your relaxing base to explore over the next few days.

CUSCO - Discover Cusco's Inca wonders, starting at the imposing ceremonial fortress of Sacsayhuamán overlooking the city. At Qenqo's ancient temple and ritual altar admire the views before continuing to Puca Pucará's hilltop watchtower and Tambomachay's architectural mastery. Venture to Cusco's city centre and the bohemian area of San Blas' cobbled streets which blend Inca and Spanish cultures. Explore the Plaza de Armas, Cusco's magnificent main square and cathedral. Finally, marvel at the majestic Koricancha, the once golden Temple of the Sun. Experience both Cusco's ancestral Inca sites and its colonial heart.

CUSCO - BOGOTA - Depart the Andes from Cusco to the next destination, Bogota. The Casa Legado is in Quinta Camacho neighbourhood with the city’s best restaurants, cafes, galleries and shops nearby. Casa Legado has a captivating mid-20th-century style, featuring 13 individually designed rooms, each with its own unique character.

BOGOTA - Uncover Bogota's historic La Candelaria district, rich in cultural heritage and Spanish colonial architecture. Highlights include Plaza de Bolivar with its Simon Bolivar statue, the Capitol housing the congress, and the Botero Museum displaying art by Botero, Picasso, and more. Visit the Gold Museum's 32,000 gold and precious artifact collection. The afternoon is yours to enjoy as you wish, perhaps listening to live music or sampling delicious local cuisine such as a bandeja paisa.

COFFEE REGION - Take a short flight to Pereira in Colombia's famed coffee region. At Finca del Café, immerse yourself in an authentic coffee plantation tour. See the planting, picking, and pulping process first-hand and roast beans the traditional way in a colonial kitchen. This hands-on experience provides an insider's look at Colombia's coffee culture where you will observe innovative techniques for drying and processing beans. Then transfer to the Sazagua Hotel, your base for two nights amid the coffee farms and rolling hills.

COFFEE REGION - Your morning adventure is to the Valle de Cocora in Quindío, home to Colombia's majestic "Quindian wax palm," the national tree. Discover the enchanting cloud forest on foot or horseback, encountering a variety of birds, from hummingbirds to the endangered palm parrots. The return journey unveils the ecological pathway along the River Quindío, providing another opportunity to marvel at the towering wax palms. In the afternoon, the exploration continues in Salento, renowned for its vibrant balconies, captivating architecture, and the scenic Cocora viewpoint. Proceed to Filandia, where colonial charm, delightful local coffee shops, and a warm regional atmosphere await to conclude the day.

COFFEE REGION - CARTAGENA - Transfer to Pereira airport for a flight to Cartagena on the Caribbean Coast. Enjoy a two-night stay at the character-filled Hotel Quadrifolio, a meticulously restored 17th-century gem. Delve into Cartagena's vibrant charm at your own pace and enjoy the atmosphere as night falls.

CARTAGENA - The tour of Cartagena, commences with a panoramic vista from the Monasterio and Iglesia de La Popa, offering breathtaking 360º views of the city and the Caribbean Sea. Journey to the San Felipe Fortress, erected as a defence against pirates, before exploring the Old City. Visit the 17th-century Convent and Church of San Pedro Claver, concluding your tour at the picturesque Bovedas. These archways, integrated into Cartagena's city wall, now house an artisan centre, showcasing local crafts and adding a touch of charm to the historic surroundings.
DEPART CARTAGENA - Transfer to the airport for your departure flight.

generalInfo:
Embark on your own slow-paced adventure to Colombia’s greatest sights; the buzzing cities of Bogota, Medellin and Cartagena; the quaint coffee region and surrounding landscapes and the remote and untamed coastal forests of Tayrona National Park.

You'll have plenty of time in each destination, to witness first the classic highlights, and then the lesser-known gems that only an extended stay allows (and we believe makes for a more memorable and fulfilling experience). Explore the vastly different cities on foot, hike in Colombia’s luscious nature, bike ride, but don’t forget to relax on some of South America’s most stunning beaches.

All of our trips can be tailormade from scratch, so take this as an example of what is possible and "Enquire Now" so we can create your very own dream adventure.

dayInfo.description: BOGOTA: Welcome to Bogota, the capital of Colombia! This city is steeped in culture, both historical and modern. Visit the highlights such as the pre-Colombia gold museum, the old town with colonial architecture and take the cable car for breath taking views over the city and the surrounding mountains. Take a street art tour with “Break Borders” an initiative formed by guides who have turned their back on their pasts to guide tourists through the myriad of art and local food in the city.

COFFEE REGION Your next stop is Colombia’s famous coffee region. Here you’ll explore the private coffee estate of the Valencia Family and learn about the coffee process from bean to cup before tasting the freshest coffee of your life! Solento is not to be missed, this enchanting Andean town with its luscious landscapes is the gateway to the iconic Coroca valley, where you can hike, or simply explore the traditional artisans, with weaving and basketry work at the forefront of their craft.

MEDELLIN: Known as the city of eternal spring due to it’s favourable climate this city has risen from the ashes and its dark past to stand at the front of Colombia’s tourism. Explore Comuna 13, the once dangerous neighbourhood to understand the huge positive change it’s undergone. A day out of the city will introduce you to Guatapé & El Peñol – a mini lake district nearby, with the opportunity to climb the rock and also visit small villages nearby.

TAYONA NATIONAL PARK. Tayrona National Park is a jewel of Colombian nature. It is a must-see and is world-renowned to be a sanctuary of nature and archaeological remains. The beautiful park is adorned with Mangrove swamps, corals, algae prairies, thorny scrubland, and magical dry, humid, and cloud forests proliferate. Spend a couple of days here relaxing and exploring the park under your own steam, you may wish to simply relax on one of the many pristine beaches.

CARTAGENA: Arguably one of the most beautiful colonial cities in all of Latin America, Cartagena mixes old world charm with Caribbean coastal vibes making it the perfect end to any trip. Here you’ll discover many influences; Romanesque, Moorish, colonial, military, Arabic, Spanish, and North American all of which shaped the city you see today. Enjoy a guided tour of the city, visit it’s castles and convents, and for the more active a bike ride with stops to taste the delicious cuisine.

tourName: San José del Guaviare tour in Colombia
generalInfo:
Embark on a once-in-a-lifetime adventure to the stunning natural wonders of San José del Guaviare. Over the course of four days, you'll explore some of the region's most breathtaking sights, from the ancient Gate of Orion to the vibrant Red River.

One of the highlights of your trip will be the chance to spot pink dolphins at Nare Lagoon, one of the few places in the world where these rare creatures can be found. Witness their playful antics as they swim and jump in the water, creating memories that will last a lifetime.

Another unforgettable experience awaits at Cerro Azul, where you'll encounter ancient rock art dating back thousands of years. Learn about the fascinating history and cultural significance of these intricate designs, and marvel at the skill and artistry of the ancient peoples who created them.

Before flying back, you'll have the opportunity to relax and unwind in the region's beautiful natural pools. Take a refreshing dip in crystal-clear waters surrounded by lush jungle scenery, immersing yourself in the tranquility and natural beauty of the region.

Throughout your journey, you'll be accompanied by expert local guides who will share their knowledge and expertise about the region, its people, and its culture.

dayInfo.description: Enjoy a relaxing 1 hr flight to San Jose. There are limited flights to San Jose and you'll be arriving at approximately 13:21 am. On arrival, you'll be collected from the airport and taken directly on your tour. Explore the stunning rock formations of Puerta de Orión, standing at 50ft wide and 40ft high, with two large holes. During December, you can observe the constellations of Orion's Belt through the upper hole. Then, enjoy a leisurely walk through the beautiful Red River area for around 2km, before heading to Caño Sabana. Admire the colorful water plant Macarenia clavíagera, unique to Colombia, and take plenty of photos. While swimming is not permitted, you can relax and soak up the magical scenery.

Leaving shortly after breakfast around 6:30 am you'll journey in a 4x4 for 2.5-3 hours to the Laguna Damas de Nare. Once here you'll enjoy an hour walk (with a few stops) for approximately 3.5km (2mi) through a beautiful natural forest full of exotic plants, birds, and monkeys. At the conclusion of this walk, you'll stop for a short break before climbing into a canoe to explore the lagoon in search of the Pink Dolphins. You'll also have the opportunity to have a swim in the lagoon, with the odd dolphin possibly playing with your feet while you're enjoying the warm waters. Next, you're back to land for a wonderful typical lunch before heading walking back through the magical forest and your waiting transport to your hotel.

Leaving shortly after breakfast at around 7:30 am you'll travel for approximately 2 hours to get to the archeological site of Cerro Azul. Once here you'll be walking through a natural jungle and a cave measuring 210m (688ft). The hike will be approximately 3 km to reach the top of the hill, during the walk and being at the top of Cerro Azul you'lle be surrounded by nature and culture, having encounters with the rock paintings of animals, people, plants, and daily life dating back more than 12000 years bp.

Embark on a morning swim in Los Pozos Naturales' natural water wells. Marvel at the changing tones of the water and the depth of some water holes. Then, enjoy a last lunch with new friends before returning home.

generalInfo:
Bring the passion of tango into your life!

Join us for a 1-4-week immersive tango dance + cultural experience in Medellin, Colombia. You get a personalized dance plan with private instruction, beautiful accommodation in the best part of town, group experiences and a community of local dancers to show you an unforgettable time.

-7 nights beautiful accommodation in the best parts of Medellin with high-speed WIFI.
-Access to local co-working space if you want to get some work done.
-Transport to and from Medellin Airport with delicious mountain water to welcome you.
-Local transport to and from our programming, when it isn’t walkable.
-24-hour support with whatever you need – we got you!

dayInfo.description: -15 hours private classes with Colombia's best dance instructors -3 hours of group classes with fellow dancers -2 nights of social dancing with dance instructors in Medellin's storied milongas -1 tango musicality class -1 gourmet Colombian style dinner with live tango dance and music performance. -1 visit to #1 Carlos Gardel museum with local tango historian.

placesVisited: Bogota, Medellin, Cartagena, Salento, Cocora Valley, Armenia, Filandia
generalInfo: Let the culture of Colombia embrace you, and the contrasts of the country reveal themselves during your custom-tailored exploration of colonial charms and high-rise luxuries, beautiful emerald jungles and white sand beaches. Contemporary murals represent the pulse of today’s culture draped across walls that span the centuries. Iridescent hummingbirds enjoy the nectar of tropical fruit and cable cars traverse the skyline above the network of city streets. From the countryside to urban museums, cultural heritage to mystic lake shores, the splendor of Colombia’s diversity will delight and captivate you.

dayInfo.title: Bogota – Arrive in Colombia’s Captivating and Bustling Capital City
dayInfo.description: Bogota bustles in the cobblestone square of the Plaza de Bolivar as a youthful ambiance emanates from the eight different universities spread around the cityscape. The emerald forest that overtakes Cerro de Monserrate rises above the northeast corner of the city to overlook the edge of the La Candelaria, Bogota’s oldest neighborhood. A funicular travels between the trees to reach the top of the summit as the mountains surround the edges of the sprawling urban expanse dotted with luxurious high-rises and murals that wash over the old walls. Your flight lands at El Dorado International Airport where your private transfer will meet you at baggage claim. Your hotel offers the best of contemporary luxuries inside the cozy ambiance inspired by colonial colors and artistry. Exotic flowers endemic to the Colombian countryside radiate down the halls and in the lobby, with abundant pinks, purples, and reds contrasting with the terracotta walls. The surrounding city offers a glimpse into the cultural amalgamation of Bogota, with Colombians gathering from all around the country inside the nation’s capital. In the afternoon, women along the cobblestone streets blend fresh fruits to make sweet, refreshing juices for passersby, filling the walkways with the aroma of pineapple and orange. A man pushes his cart near the business district offering arepas , delicious corncakes, beside a woman grilling corn. You settle into the comforts of your hotel with the rhythm of salsa drifting out of the colonial homes of La Candelaria and filling the public plazas around the city.

dayInfo.title: Bogota – Explore Bogota’s Historical Streets and Cultural Museums
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the restaurants and cafes around the Chapinero district open for the residents of the high-rise luxury apartments that add to Bogota’s skyline. Fruit vendors return to the cobbled walkways of the city to stack the fresh produce on ice and present the delicious mangos and jackfruit to passersby. Students fill the street en route to Universidad Santo Tomas, and the aroma of sweet crepes emanates from the popular local restaurants that abound. Your guide will meet you at your hotel after breakfast eager to lead you through the historical streets of La Candelaria and into the Museo de Arte del Banco de la Republica, a museum complex that houses five separate institutions. The pastel colors that decorate the facades of the colonial homes in the neighborhood trickle onto the Baroque and art-deco inspired architecture built in the later years. Wrought iron balconies overlook avenues and the peak of Monserrate rises above the end of the street. The foundations for the Church of John Bosco were laid in the mid 19th century, and the façade features candy cane striping that leads upwards into the central spire. Frescoes adorn the tripartite doors depicting stoic saints. When you arrive at the museum complex, you will enter into the Museo del Oro, the famous gold museum of Bogota that exhibits the indigenous people’s connection to the precious metal. The history of the country leading up to and past the arrival of the Spanish is told through a collection of more than 55,000 gold artifacts. The galleries glint with intricate sculptures and jewelry, including the Muisca Raft, a gold votive established to recreate the crowning of the chief crafted as early as the 7th century.

dayInfo.title: Bogota – Enjoy a Full Day Excursion to Lake Guatavita’s Mystic Scenery
dayInfo.description: The sunlight will wash over the exterior of the Museo Iglesia Santa Clara, one of the oldest churches in the city erected in the 17th century. The interior glints with gold paint that drapes over the walls and ceiling to embellish the more than 145 paintings and sculptures that represent various saints. After breakfast, your guide will greet you in the hotel lobby eager to immerse you in more of the regional culture, along with the hidden treasures found in and around Bogota. You will leave the borders of the city behind you, passing the eclectic images of the murals that decorate the city’s structural walls. The art pieces offer insight into local movements and show the pulse of the people, representing topics ranging from pop culture to politics. The city streets fade into the winding roadways of the mountains, bordered by lush rainforest. The scent of wet soil and herbaceous leaves graces the air outside your vehicle. Guatavita Lake is located less than 30 miles outside of Bogota, and mountain summits encircle the sparkling cobalt water that reflects the greenery found along its edges. Your guide will remind you of the Muisca Raft you saw in the Gold Museum, which encapsulates the rituals performed on the waters of this very lake. During the ceremony, the incoming chief would cover himself in gold powder before plunging into the water to obtain the powers of the deities. The short hike to the top of the lakeside takes you to a lookout at an altitude of 9,800 feet above sea level, and treasure hunters believed the lake was the source of the mystical city of El Dorado.

dayInfo.title: Armenia – Travel to Armenia, the Capital of the QuindÃ­o Coffee Region
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the shops in the Galeria Artesanal de Colombia open their doors to visitors and locals alike.
